Title: Long Lover of Crocs. Don't worry about sizes for UK Buyers
Review: Just bought these for the Mrs. She is a size 6 so I got Men UK 5 / Women UK 6 and they fit perfectly. The last pair of Crocs I bought lasted 7 years so these are made to last. Brilliant and comfortable for the forthcoming summer days.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 April 2020

Title: Confusing sizes!! Womans are affected also!! Buy size larger!!
Review: These crocs are really soft , flexible and so comfy! My only problem was with the size! And can I say that it's NOT JUST  mens sizes which need altering it's women's too!! I'm always a size 4 yet on the soles of these it has UK sizes but says 'M3 / W4'....which totally confused me, so I ordered 2 pairs and the 2nd pair says UK sizes 'M4/W5' which still confuses me!! (How can a man's size be a 3 and the same shoe for a woman size 4? OR Man's size 4 and woman's size 5?) Anyway moving on. ...the upshot of all this was the M3/W4 were small (felt more like a size 3!) and the M4/W5 were just right (felt like a size 4!) So... FOR WOMEN pick a size BIGGER!!
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 April 2016

Title: Pot Luck
Review: I'm a size 6 and have worn crocs for years as ladies size 6 and my feet measurement on the chart says size 6. Ordered a new pair in Candy Pink, but they were way to small. My toes were sticking out of the holes at the front, they had been made in Mexico, whereas previously we've had them from China, Italy and Bosnia. At best they could have passed for a 4 1/2. They were returned and I ordered the next size (7). These were made in Italy and whilst being a bit big, I've kept them as it seems to be pot luck on where they are made. Crocs really need to sort out this sizing lark once and for all.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 October 2019

Title: What is wrong with these sizes?!?
Review: Pros: They're comfy, they're washable, they don't make your feet sweat, they come in lots of colours, the price-tag of Â£20 was great value.Cons: YOU REALLY DO NEED A SIZE SMALLER THAN ADVERTISED!As other reviewers have stated, the sizing seems to differ from one country of manufacture to another. The first pair I ordered, before returning, were made in Romania. These were large enough to accommodate both feet in one shoe (if I'd have wanted to). The second pair, this time made in Vietnam, were a good fit. Note, I said "good fit"; if anything, I thought they were ever-so-slightly too-small but I've decided to keep them as they don't feel uncomfortable & should stay on my feet. I'm talking about bare feet. Not thick socks. Worn for the pool & beach. Not for gardening in all weathers. What is WRONG with you?
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 July 2019

Title: Great shoes for beach and garden!
Review: I use a pair of crocs for beach walks (no fear of getting them wet and the sand slips through the holes!) and walking around the garden- so they are very useful. Plastic burns my feet but this material doesnâ€™t.  I had a pair but my dog took one and I couldnâ€™t find it anywhere. So I bought these. And guess what- my dog brought back the missing croc! So I have a pair for the beach and a pair for the garden. Excellent. Iâ€™m a 37/UK 4 and find this size (36 US 6) a tiny bit small if I use the strap on my heel (useful for walking up the garden slopes) but next size up would be too big.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 April 2020

Title: Pomegranate Crocs! What's not to like!
Review: OK, first off I am a Croc fan. I've even been to the Croc Shop in Vegas!And these Classic Crocs are great. Same Croc comfort, same Croc design - and a great new colour.A couple of things. The product heading says "Women's Classic Crocs" - actually, they are unisex.They are also "relaxed" fit - great for my wide feet.Size wise - Croc sizes can be confusing. I take a UK 81/2 size E.These are Men's UK size 9 - they are stamped on the sole M10 - American size.And they are a great, slightly loose (aka "Roomy") fit for me.If you have narrower feet, consider a Croc style which is badged "Relaxed" or, for narrow feet, "Standard" instead.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 November 2018

Title: Not as good as the old style
Review: They have changed the shape and feel of Classic Crocs which I think is a shame. I prefer the rounded wide front and squishiness of my old style crocs, these are considerably narrower at the front. I'm sure they have done this to try and make them less disagreeable to the anti-croccers, but actually they look more silly in their new slimline shape. They are also firmer- I preferred them soft.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 March 2016

Title: Very comfortable
Review: I think i may be in love with these shoes. I have a lot of pain issues with one of my feet and i would now live in these if i possibly could they are so comfy and well supported. I use these ones as slippers around the house. The only thing i find is that my feet can get a little sweaty in them if it is hot. However they are plastic shoes, this seems reasonable, and they do not cause the blisters that were such a problem with the old fashion plastic 'jelly' shoes. I ordered the size i am usually and these fitted perfectly. That you can shoes to have the back strap down of swing it forward to wear like a clog is also very good.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 October 2017

Title: Legit. Comfy & perfect fit
Review: I was really dubious about these as I was unsure on the size, but I checked out reviews and went with my usual shoe size (UK5 ladies) and they are perfect!They came in a plastic bag, but all of the relevant (authentic) labels and logos are present and correct.SO comfy and feel great.Very happy with the delivery time (Prime customer so 24 hours despite Covid-19) brilliant!Driver was really pleasant, kept within his social distance, had a mask on and I was really impressed. These people work SO hard for us customers, particularly during these very worrying times; so thank you Amazon!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 May 2020

Title: Delightful Shoes - everyone loves them.
Review: Delightful shoes. Comfortable, light, flexible, easy to wash - several times a day if necessary - easy to put on and take off - just excellent.This colour - yellow - is by far my favourite colour for Crocs.You simply would not believe the number of people - friends, acquaintances and total strangers - who have taken the trouble to stop and tell me how much they like my shoes, how cheerful they are, and how they made them smile.I might get another pair just in case these wear out one day - though my previous Crocs were bought 16 years ago, were worn more or less every day, and have still not worn out.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Lemon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 August 2018

Title: Expensive but quality
Review: Much much better than the cheapo copies available on the High Street and with the added benefit of not having a pungent manufacturing smell. You only get what you pay, time will tell if the original lasts longer.  The purchasing process was complicated though. I ordered UK men's size 9 but at the checkout this had changed to size 8. Started again from scratch and same thing happened so was wondering what exactly would turn up and not happy at the prospect of having to break self-isolation to do a return. Thankfully this didn't happy but the supplier needs to sort out this anomaly.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 August 2020

Title: Extremely comfortable ðŸ™‚ never have them off my feet, fantastic!
Review: I bought these back in August, never have them off my feet!Crocs are sometimes quite difficult to buy judging by the sizes advertised, so I thought I'd hopefully help others buy with confidence!I am a true ladies size 4 (UK) but my size in these particular styled Crocs, I buy a size down which is stated (UK)M3/L4 & (US)4-6.Very confusing, but I hope this helps!I have also just purchased a pair for a friend who is a size 8 (UK). He tried on for size today and I ended up buying him a size M7/L8 which is a size smaller!These Crocs are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn, ideal for many occasions.In the summer I wear the Crocs Kadee style which are toe bar style, amazing!I hope this helps at least one person! ðŸ˜˜
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 November 2020

Title: Sizing issues
Review: I eventually swapped to Crocs Unisex-Adult's Classic Clogs, (Dusty Green), M 8/W 9 from a M 9/W 10 which I bought as I was told M9 meant Mens 9.  The M 8/W 9 is a UK LARGE men size 9 both in terms of length and width.  Although I'm normally Men 9.5 size, the 9 is a bit large which makes me wonder if I should have got an 8.  Also there is no Mens chart, no UK sizes displayed and no half sizes - all very confusing.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2019

Title: Sort out your sizing, Crocs!
Review: Others have commented on the strange sizing of Crocs, which seems to depend on whether they're made in Italy or China. I already had a pair of size 7s, which are roomy, so I only wear them round the house and garden.  And my son wears them (he's a size 9).  I needed something big to wear following a broken ankle so ordered a pair of black size 7.  They arrived and were visibly much smaller than the ones I already had. Small pair made in Italy, large pair made in China, both purporting to be size 7.  Really annoying.  I exchanged for a size 8 which is about the right size on my 'normal' foot - but I'm not usually an 8!Surely such a well known brand should be able to get its sizing right!
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 April 2013

Title: Crocs, nuff  said.
Review: Crocs are, for me, functional footware. I only use them in the garden or when nipping out of the house for a very short while (to the recycling centre for example) when nice shoes would be pointless. They do all that I ask of them, the heel strap is useful when climbing ladders but they are mostly used without, allowing easy shedding when coming inside from a mucky job. They will not keep out moisture but can be hosed down when needed. I do not buy them for their comfort, they are NOT good walking shoes. I do however have at least two pairs in my possession at all times - one lined one not. It took many years to wear out my first pair. I shall hope these last as long.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 October 2020

Title: These might not look the best buy omg are they comfortable
Review: ProsCan wear in all weathersEasy to cleanComfortableSlip-on or rear strapGood sole gripLong lastingLight weightConsDon't look greatSlippy on shiny wet surfacesPriceyI've had my last pair of these 12 years and they have only just worn out. I use them for putting the bins out, nipping in and out of the house, when on holiday on the beach and in the summer.These are a great pair of easy to wear shoes as long as you don't mind how they look.My feet are overpronationand these give me enough support on long walks. They have never given me blisters.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 October 2020

Title: Crocs are Crocs!
Review: Having owned Crocs before, these were exactly what I expected. Bought as slippers for wearing in the house only. I wear with thick socks as the toe box is big and they are wide generally. Although shaped inside, there is relatively little arch support. Plastic is soft and maleable. I find the little bumps inside comfortable. In shoes I'm normally a 3 / 3.5 but smallest here was M4/W6 - a wee tad big but nothing major. Would still recommend.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2020

Title: Croc Convert (+ Size tip!)
Review: Ok so Iâ€™m obsessed. How are these so comfortable?! Definitely converted to Crocs now. I got them to have something easy & waterproof to slip on to nip out the back garden, and let the dog out, etc. I could definitely live in these, theyâ€™re so comfortable.My tip for SIZE! This was the thing I was worried about because wow so much conflicting info, and sizes Iâ€™ve never seen before! The thing I did was to look at the size chart in this listing and literally measure my foot with a tape measure! This told me I was actually a 6 and not a 5 as I was expecting; and the clogs fit lovely. I am a 5 - 5.5 usually, never a 6, but itâ€™s ok for these. So Iâ€™d advise that for fit
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 September 2020

Title: A Good exam question
Review: A man walks into a shoe shop. He is normally a size 8 UK or 42 EU, but Crocs sizing varies. Crocs are made in Vietnam, Mexico, Italy, and other countries. Crocs usually size big but sometimes might size small., depending on where they are made. The man likes a neat fit. Amazon, customers, 3rd-party sellers, and Crocs are all confused about sizing. Amazon sometimes list them incorrectly and send out the wrong size. Which size should our customer order?* * * * *So apart from the sizing chaos, I like Crocs. Recommended, if you can pass the exam question above.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2020

Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Crocs!
Review: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Crocs!  I've developed arthritis in all the toes on my right foot, so it can be incredibly painful, but wearing  Crocs is like walking on a cushion, such a relief!  I've had much cheaper versions previously, but you definitely get what you pay for, they didn't last long before the soles wore so thin, I couldn't wear them outside.  I bought a second pair of Crocs for wearing around the house, plus 2 pairs for my husband, he's converted!  The service was excellent, will definitely be recommending them, they're amazing!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 July 2019

Title: Black Crocs Classic Unisex Adult T-Bar
Review: I do like Crocs, How ever...The first pair I bought were too big! They were like boats on my feet. I did keep them though, for wearing in my garden . I read on a review about these shoes that at womens UK size 6 was a 7 ladies and a mens size 6. It was much too big for me.I have now bought the size down 38 /39. Which is also meant to fit a ladies size 6 UK size.  The new ones should be Ok, fingers crossed. As I have another pair I bought from some one else a few years ago. But sadly wasn't able to get to them ,to see the size when buying mine  from here.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2017

Title: Crocs - genuine and good quality
Review: Seem like genuine Crocs. Clompy, unfashionable but invaluable, either for camping or popping into the garden. Makes you realise how worn the old ones were as these have good grip both inside and on the sole! Genuine crocs have the advantage of bring both less slippy and having more durable straps. In the past, I have also taken them into Crocs shops when the kids' posts, holding the straps, have come out and been lost. In each case, these were replaced free of charge which is an exceptional service from Crocs.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 August 2020

Title: Fantastically comfortable
Review: These Crocs are the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. I have slightly wide feet and a touch of arthritis in my big toe so finding comfortable footwear is a constant struggle. I could wear these shoes all day I think. Also the colour is lovely - they're advertised as Brown (garnet), no idea why as they're not brown at all, just a lovely deep rich red.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 July 2018

Title: really big and size guide does not help...
Review: Such a shame I was really looking forward to these - desperate for garden clogs! They are like boats.... I measured my feet and used the sizing guide but it's not worked out for some reason.  I went half a size larger to allow for the shrinkage that many reviews mention, but the crocs are more than an inch longer than my feet!  Sadly I need to return them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 November 2018

Title: Perfect
Review: I bought these for my son to wear in the garden as he kept stealing mine. He is a large size UK 12, I wasn't sure how big they would come up due to mixed comments. Due to their width, he could have gone down a size but we stuck with the 12 as it's only for the garden.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2020

Title: Buy a larger size if you use the strap behind your heel
Review: My feet are size 3 and a half UK. I bought English sizing M3 W4 36/37 My toes touched the end when I used the strap as this brings the sole forward. They would have been ok if you donâ€™t use the strap. I returned them and bought the next size up. On the bottom these are labelled made in Bosnia M5 W7 which is the US sizing. These are English M4 W5 W37/38 I advise you to order up a size if you use the strap. They are very comfortable.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 September 2019

Title: American sizing!!
Review: Although I ordered UK women's size 7, the crocs I got were US size 7 / 9 (women's / men's size) which would be a UK size 5 according to Amazons sizing info.  Luckily however I wanted these to wear in the garden and for decorating etc (at Â£16 they were ideal!) and with the heel strap forward they are a comfortable fit for such things.  I can wear the heel strap back for short periods but they do cramp my toes a little so I couldn't wear them for walking any distance.I am a UK size 6.5 and if I were buying crocs for walking I would, on the basis of these, buy an American size 8/10 - so in short I think if I had got the size I ordered ( American 9/11) they would have been too big!!As for the crocs - I don't think I would wear these (even in the right size) other than for working around the house but I've only had them a week so maybe they'll grow on me :). It's a styling thing really, i just don't think they are "me". But as a sturdy, comfortable shoe that I can wear while cleaning the pond or decorating, they are brilliant.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 July 2014

Title: Croctastic!
Review: Crocs are a product which you either love or hate.  My partner loves them as holiday footwear.Ideally you wear these without socks.  They will leave your feet dry and give you an added spotty foot! (with the tan lines)You can also wear then around the pool.Fair enough, they aren't the most prettiest things on the market, but hey you are on your holidays, who cares?Bought a few times - no complaints.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 October 2018

Title: ... to a cheaper variant and she is more than happy with them
Review: These were bought for my wife as a replacement to a cheaper variant and she is more than happy with them. With all new shoes you expect them to be a bit stiff on first wear and these are no different but then again the name speaks for itself.These were a ladies size 7 and they fit her feet perfectly. They are great for lounging about the house or in the garden. The sole has a decent grip for walking although I wouldn't advise walking for long distances in them as they are not a walking shoe. She can even drive wearing these as the little loop strap can be placed behind the heel or worn as a sandal when placed over the bridge of the foot.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 February 2016

Title: Pleasantly surprised
Review: As someone who has a bit of a time finding shoes to fit properly and not destroy my feet within an hour or so, I'm really pleasantly surprised they're quite a decent fit.  I generally need a wider fit shoe and these have given me that with extra room.Very comfortable and don't feel as though I'm about to walk out of them at any point.Only loses a star has they were a bit darker than the image on the product page showed.  (Tropical Teal)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 August 2019

Title: Are you cooler than your footware?
Review: Fast delivery. Exactly as expected. Personally I love them. Super practical and convenient. Nobody else likes them (crocs) but that suits me just fine. Nobody nicks them - I have never followed a crowd and donâ€™t intend to start now. Perfect beach / boat / bbq and bins out shoe
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 June 2018

Title: Absolutely love them. Very roomy and exceptionally light in weight ...
Review: Bought for use in place of house slippers. Absolutely love them. Very roomy and exceptionally light in weight on your feet. I suffer with bunions and need comfort as oppose to high fashion and I was not disappointed. I bought them in pink to match my dressing gown. The bonus is I can also wash them when necessary. I take a size 6 when there isn't a half size and since I need the width with my bunions found these were just perfect. I would recommend them to anyone.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 September 2017

Title: Slightly larger than a UK12
Review: Bought these for a friend who always buy crocs clogs and always a size 12. However, strangely these are listed as a 12 but when they arrived said 13 on the sole. I am aware of the many different crocs sizings, it depends on where they were made and what market they were made for, hence the M and W. These did say they are a UK12 (m13) but they are bigger than the usual UK12 I have bought so many times. My friend kept them as he only uses crocs for gardening but they are bigger.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 March 2017

Title: I love ðŸ’“ my crocs
Review: I bought my last pair 13 years ago, I wear them like slippers, so popping to the bin is easy , I garden in them , wear them camping , on the beach , in shower if camping . 13 years later I decided to treat myself to a new pair , no theyâ€™re not a fashion statement, but theyâ€™re so practical . My daughter also buys them for her work as a vet
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 July 2020

Title: What are int'l shoe standards for?
Review: I already had a pair of Crocs size 12 UK, tha fit perfetly These I ordered now came with 12M marked, and fit just a bit smaller. However, the tags said this pair was size 12 UK, equal to 48/49 EU. As far as I know, my feet always fit 12 UK or 47 EU, as they are 29,8 cm long. All this looks complicated? I make it simple: I'll never again buy a pair of Crocs if not ONLY in UK sizes. There is a big confusion with the international shoe sizing standards all arround Europe, european shoemakers ( or should I say chinese shoemakers) just don't respect rules.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 May 2016

Title: Unfortunately they send the wrong size
Review: Unfortunately I received the wrong size and I didnt checked it properly before I shipped it abroad, so now the person I gifted is wearing it only indoors and the pair is one size bigger than the one I ordered, so not very happy. The second start instead of only one is because the colour is very vibrant and lovely
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Lemon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 October 2020

Title: well 'andy!
Review: Croc's, dunno why they call 'em that, but hey their good. They don't smell their loose on your feet but still grip even if they are a size too big, but thats what all the other reviewers said, and i'm glad i took their advise to get one size bigger cos looser the better.They are so light on your feet you wouldn't know you got 'em on, they've got a patterned surface on the inside of the sole that feels a bit rough to start with bit after a time you get used to it and it kinda massages ya feet.Your feet do sweat a bit but with the holes all over the croc the air kinda cools ya feet.Yer they do look a bit ungainly like the typical clodhoppers of old and its a bit weird going out in 'em when you first get ya crocs, but take my word they are really comfortable. A mate of mine wore em when they first came out and they looked weird and he's a fashion guru, but i can see now why he wore em.Their made of some sort of hard polystyrene and the strap can either be used for the front for slip-ons or the the back to hold 'em on, even with the strap down to the shoe they don't flip off.Happy? yes well happy, for the price of 'em its good value and for comfort.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2013

Title: Just the Job
Review: Advised by my podiatrist to wear crocs rather than flip-flops & slip on sandles, around home use. 65 with 2 tin his (sadly not a 32" waist) - playing competative club golf again, walking, biking, etc.. But hit some problems with Plantar Facitus ( excuse spelling ?) - problems with ligament underside foot to heel.Crocs another part of the tool kit to keep the old body going on the active stuff - at this age and general life long sporting wear & tear - there is no one magic cure all - its a matter of finding anything that helps the cause a "little" - and Crocs do.Best price I could find Â£16 - possibly could be a little cheaper ?For the fashion conscious - navy blue appears to go with most things.Nb.  Initially took note of reviews - suggesting need to purchase one size larger - I am a "full" wide fitting uk. size10 - so initially bought size 11 - wrong !!  -  much too big, length & wdth  - replaced with size 10 - perfect.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 October 2013

Title: Far too big to be a UK 8
Review: The only complaint with this product is the sizing.  Usually I wear a UK 9 in normal shoes, but as Iâ€™d ordered a UK size 8 for crocs last time, thatâ€™s what ordered this time.The crocs that arrived claim to be an 8 but theyâ€™ve got to be closer to an 11 in normal shoes. I will be able to use them but I just wish they could sort the sizing issue out.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 June 2020

Title: Check out the fit first!
Review: Appears to be a great quality pair of shoes. BUT sadly not the right fit. Despite no mention in the product description, these are a 'roomy fit' - which is too loose for me. Was this an accident, or what the item is supposed to be? Who knows. A reminder of the value of being able to 'try before you buy' on the high street. Best ask the question, BEFORE you buy.
Size: Size: 8 UK Men/ 9 UK WomenColour: Bronze
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 December 2020

Title: Size not as advertised
Review: Bought size advertised as M4/W5 as I am a UK 5. When they arrived, they are marked M5/W7. They only just fit me. Be careful when ordering as sizing is very confusing. Service prompt. Decided not to return as I can get away with this fit although it is much more snug then I expected
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 May 2019

Title: Versatile, airy and cushioned casual clog.  Very durable.  Excellent price.  3rd pair, would like more colours still.
Review: My 3rd pair of crocks.  I've got joint problems in my back so I find the shock-absorbing abilities of these a real blessing !  Plus they have little bobbles in the inside so you get a small massage every time you put your foot down !The airvents are equally great for summer when you're doing a lot of walking round National Trust properties in the sunshine.  I also use them in the garden, round the house, for driving, the beach and when I want to wear comfortable shoes that don't have a heel or squish my feet up !!
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 April 2017

Title: Crocs clog.
Review: I am a size 6 women's shoe, a little on the wide side of fitting. I ordered size M6 - W8 ....I got a perfect fit. Mine have been made in Bosnia. Just thought it worth a mention as there seems to be so many variations of size out there!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 March 2020

Title: Good value
Review: Really good crocks that are very dark blue, almost black. Crocs are generally well made and comfortable and this was no exception. They have a nice thick sole which makes it very pleasant to walk. I actually use them instead of slippers around the house.The only thing I would say is that they are moderately small although I have to say that I prefer really lose fitting crocs type shoes so it might be just down to my personal preference, rather than crocs making them on the smallish side.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 December 2016

Title: Not a very generous fit
Review: I usually buy Croc lookalikes (or mock crocs as I refer to them) from a well known high street shoe shop, but they seem to wear down on the heel quite quickly, so I thought I'd try the branded one's. I have wide feet, so purchase men's size 7 in the mock croc version. Other reviewers stated that sizing depended greatly on where their Crocs were made, but as I had no idea in advance which version I would receive, I thought I should stick with a size 7. I have to say mine are a little on the small side - not only narrower but also shorter in length. I wear them instead of slippers, so during the summer months they fit fine, but I cannot wear them with socks once it gets cooler - there simply isn't enough room in them. I think in future I will stick with the 2 pairs for Â£8.00 mock crocs, and just replace them more often. I find it rather ironic that a cheaper high street pair, is more generously sized than the expensive branded version.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2015

Title: Crocs are brilliant
Review: Not decrying cheap imitations but you can't beat the original crocs, whether as a slipper, garden shoe, water shoe or general kick about they are so light and comfortable on your feet, you forget got them on. Just make sure you buy the right size. Its american sizing on the shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 December 2020

Title: Great product, crocs made in Bosnia are brilliant; but Vietnamese ones are uncomfortable.
Review: Super comfy ventilated footwear. Great grip on wet stone. I wish I'd bought these ages ago. One word of warning: the bobbles on the inside of the sole of the ones made in Bosnia are rounded and very comfy. I bought a pair of crocs made in Vietnam, both through Amazon, and the bobbles inside the sole were very sharp and uncomfortable - had to send them back.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 August 2019

Title: Fabulous design footwear.
Review: They're broader than I expected, but that's good as I like my big feet to look even bigger!  They're perfectly comfy, and I can easily slip them on and keep them on, whichever way I wear the strap; the 'pimply' footbeds are very well/anatomically designed.  I love the vivid green colour, and the Croc logo pics on the rivets holding the straps on.  I love that I can wear them indoors and out, and that they are very quickly and easily washable, and unharmed if I go outside in the wet.  I only wish I'd got some years ago!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 June 2016

Title: Roomier fit than expected
Review: I wear Crocs around the house as indoor shoes and find them very comfortable. I always buy a size 8 (as I did with these) but these particular Crocs are a bit bigger than the other size 8 Crocs I own. The product label describes them as 'roomy fit', a style which I didn't know existed. I probably could have got away with buying a size 7 (if I'd known in advance how roomy these shoes are). These Crocs don't fit as nicely as my other size 8 Crocs but are still fine for wearing while wandering around the house. I'm reviewing them to mention that they are a larger fitting style just in case other shoppers would find the info useful.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 October 2014

Title: Crocs Classic mules...
Review: Very comfortable, light and not at all bulky...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2019

Title: Who doesnt own a pair of crocs?
Review: I bought these as a warehouse deal and they came through without branded packaging but appeared as brand new with tags.This is my second pair, bought the first several years ago, the soles wore thin and the straps detached, but i've kept them for garden use.Sure, they're kind of ugly but very practical. i use mine to cycle to the swimming pool ie can slip them on and off fast. And also to visit  a food gardening project where I need some protection from scratching etc and dont want to trash nice shoes, or wear heavy wellies in summerThey are very light to wear and comfy, with or without socks..The navy is a nice discreet colour.I would add that re sizing I am nearly always a 6/39, but take a 5 in crocs.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 August 2013

Title: The colour slightly more pink than peachy
Review: I bought the melon clogs (and another newer style of the crocs) and I have decided to return these. Mainly because although wide enough they were a bit smaller for me lengthwise and the colour wasnâ€™t (due to the screen on my computer) as expected.But yes comfort wise crocs never disappoint!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2020

Title: Funky item for holidays
Review: These shoes were huge a few years ago although their popularity has waned dramatically.My partner and I spend a few weeks each year in Spain and do a lot of walking when we are there.  She tells me they are the most comfortable shoes she has ever worn long distances.  Due to the design, she lauds the fact that they are also the coolest shoes.  They are suitable for wear with or without socks (trainer socks - please!) and due to their rubber nature very easy to clean - just get a wet flannel and viola!These would suit the older generation on their winter escapes abroad - makes a big change from needing to find shoes that are watertight!Please note that each colour is a different price, and this can vary enormously.  For example an orange pair is currently Â£25 whereas the black Â£17.  Doesn't make sense to me!!!These can also be used as slippers.Well worth the money.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 January 2014

Title: A long time fan of crocs!
Review: I bought these crocs to wear as slippers, as I have done for many years. I finally got around to replacing my last pair, which had served me well for three years but the grips on the bottom were finally beginning to wear smooth. The colour is vibrant, and as always to fit is as expected and very comfortable. I have recommended to everyone I know, and now my parents and my father-in-law also wear them around the house instead of conventional slippers. Not only are they comfortable, but they are also supportive of the foot and have very good grips, which I have found to be invaluable on our steep staircase. No doubt I will wear these until there is no wear left in them and replace once again! Fantastic quality and this particular pair was a bargain.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 January 2015

Title: Really difficult to understand the sizing
Review: Love the colour and find Crocs very useful.  BUT, trying to understand the sizing is really, really difficult.  The advert seems to suggest the man's size is smaller than the woman's - unless the 'm' is supposed to mean 'medium' in width.  I suggest buying 2 or 3 pairs and returning the ones that don't fit!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 August 2020

Title: Comfortable but too wide a fit
Review: Fits larger than expected, mainly for people with not so wide feet. I am normally a size 9, but I can fit easily into an 8 with room to spare. A smaller size than an 8 would mean itâ€™s too short toe to heel. I wear this with scrubs, so it is fine for my purpose, but I wouldnâ€™t like the fit, if I had to walk about for any reasonable distance.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 August 2019

Title: Super comfy to wear all day at work.
Review: I bought these crocs as I stand for long shifts at a time at work and wanted something comfy that I could also slip my feet out of occasionally to wiggle my toes without having to unlace or unzip. Looking at previous reviews I was concerned about sizing but I am a size ladies 7 and thatâ€™s what I ordered and they fit perfectly. I know theyâ€™re not the most stylish of shoes but theyâ€™re super comfy so that does for me while I am at work.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 June 2020

Title: Theyâ€™re ok
Review: Ordered an 8 ( menâ€™s ) but says a 9 on the bottom. Theyâ€™re also very wide!! They were a present ( early Oct birthday ) plus Iâ€™ve missed the return window so Iâ€™ve had to pass them On to someone with with wider feet. Donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll be ordering a new pair as I can get the same for cheaper elsewhere. But the quality looked good.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 October 2020

Title: The way that these Crocs are sized is just not working go back to the drawing board.
Review: I have purchased about ten pairs of these crocs over the last two years and by using the size chart provided.It's hit and miss whether you will get the right size to fit it's either too small or too big.On the very rare occasion, you will get a pair to fit me. So, as a result, I have about six pairs never worn because they are too big such a waste of money so I would be very reluctant to purchase another pair going forward.Don't get me wrong I love the comfort of Crocs but I'm not going to waste any more money it's just not worth it!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 June 2020

Title: Better than described! 100% recommend
Review: In love with these! Been wearing them for work in operating theatres for almost 3 months now and the colour is so bright and has not faded. If they get dirty, it's really easy to clean them, they dry quickly and have kept their shape (unlike my old sketchers). On my feet for 13 hours a day, feels like I'm walking on a cloud!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 April 2020

Title: Definitely go a size smaller...
Review: Wish I read the reviews. Sizes are too big. Definitely go a size smaller.Itâ€™s not the end of the world as I can still wear them but itâ€™s annoying that they donâ€™t fit as well as they would if I went a size smaller than my usual fit.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 November 2020

Title: Foot pain relief.
Review: I bought these after realising my gardening Crocs clogs gave relief from painful planter fascists.  I wear them around the house instead of slippers.  My foot pain disappears when I am wearing them. I wouldnâ€™t say they would work for everyone but they have been a great relief for me.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Pepper
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 March 2020

Title: Check your sizes, they are BIG!
Review: Well what a shame, my first pair of Crocs and I have had to return them as they are waaay to big. UK size 9, Euro size 43 is my size and this is the size of Crocs I bought and ended up with but I'd say that they are more like a 10 if not 11... even with socks and having rather wide feet these things flopped about on my feet.Every other shoe I have ever had, from Ecco and Clarks to all makes of wellies I have always fitted a 9 or Euro 43, but not these. I guess it may be a Crocs specific thing but i wish someone had told me!Lesson learnt, despite the speedy delivery and hassle free return procedure with stuff like shoes and clothes it's just easier to go and try it on in a good old shop.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 September 2015

Title: Go for them, they are ideal for pottering outside.
Review: Croc's........a bit like Marmite. I have steared away from purchasing a pair for years but having finally succumbed I couldn't be more pleased. Easy to slip on and off comfortable and ideal for pottering in the garden or on the camp site.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 October 2020

Title: Happy with fit
Review: I've had a pair of crocs for about 10 years so was time to replace them! But sizing was different so got very confusing and could only really get them online as shops dont seem to stock  the origional ones now. So after a few failed attempts at getting the size correct I came across these ones which said they were a UK ladies size 5 and they were a good fit (my old ones were a ladies size 4 and were a bit big) I am a UK Ladies size 5 so very happy as in my opinion they were sized correctly ðŸ˜Š
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 March 2018

Title: Fab-u-lous colour and fit
Review: I love the zingy colour of my new crocs.  I now understand better the sizing of them and so have a pair that fit perfectly.  Size 10 UK (though has 11 on the sole which is the US sizing) fits my size 9 but very wide feet brilliantly.  A joy to wear!  Also arrived quickly when ordered.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 October 2020

Title: Not fashionable but soo comfy
Review: I originally got a pair of these for work as they were practical and easily washed clean.  Loved them right from the start.  Then a couple of years ago my mum broke her foot and the only thing she could wear was my 'butt ugly horrible things' as she used to call them.  So suddenly these were acceptable to wear and I lost mine for a while so she could move around comfortably.  I ordered another pair for myself and a pair for her and we have both worn them ever since.Then a couple of weeks back, my dad has a pain in his heal and the only shoe which was comfortable to wear was my mum's crocs but then she was suffering without hers, so again back to amazon for another pair!!  I have had to order some jobbitz (sparkly of course) for my mum's crocs so they know which ones are which!!Be warned though, they shrink if left in the heat for long periods of time.  I forgot about my old pair and left them in my hot car for 8hrs, when I went to put them on for work, I found I couldn't get my feet in them as they had shrunk.  So that pair went off to my sister who has tiny feet!So from having a family who originally took the mick out of me for wearing crocs to work are now suddenly the family who all live in their crocs!!Am signed up to Amazon Prime and service was great, ordered them late on Saturday and received them Monday lunchtime.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 July 2013

Title: I normally wear a size 8. 5 - 9 ...
Review: I normally wear a size 8.5 - 9 in UK shoes so I bought the size f9/m8 in UK sizes for these thinking they may be a little snug but being rubber that they would stretch over time... OH.... MY..... GOD!!.... Massive or what!? I can step in and out of them without touching the sides, I gave them to my dad and am gonna reorder in the size f7/m6 (that's TWO sizes smaller than the first pair and 3 sizes smaller than my actual foot size).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 November 2017

Title: Quality, genuine product stayed at price. Will happily shop here again.
Review: O use these as I would a pair of (carpet) slippers. They are easy to slip in and out of, really comfortable and look good on. But area finally tough enough to wear for a trip to the bottom of the garden. The material they are made of is non absorbent and wipes clean with a damp cloth. In The summer they are cool to wear but manage the neat trick of being warm in the winter. At the price a great useful bargain. Prompt delivery will see me shopping with this seller again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 August 2018

Title: Perfect campsite shower shoes
Review: Love these. We have previously have bought cheaper "versions" and expected these to be not much better however they are much better than the cheaper alternatives. Good for campsite showers, not sure I would wear the daily as they do get sweaty and slippy.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 May 2020

Title: Love Crocs
Review: This is my 3rd pair of crocs. These are for in the house as our new puppy manages to hurt my feet through slippers.Very comfortable.Don't leave them outside in the sun for long periods (as I did with my first pair) as they shrink.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 August 2020

Title: Cant wear strap
Review: I have a pair of Crocs exactly the same size.so felt confident buying on line , but these are totally different, If worn as flip flops they are fine if you want the ankle strap on they are way to tight.Returned
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 December 2020

Title: I'm hooked!
Review: I never thought I'd be a Crocs wearer, it seemed like something that happened to other people and then.... Amazon had a sale and I took the plunge.  Boy, am I glad I did!  Not only are these incredibly comfortable to wear, but they are really robust and protective when I'm wandering around the garden or home.  I love that you can use them with or without the back down - relevant if you're wearing thick socks on a cold day or none during summer.  I am a size UK 7 and these are a perfect fit.  Will definitely watch out for more on offer in the next Amazon sale...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 November 2015

Title: Brill!
Review: What can be said about crocs? They are incredibly comfortable and hard wearing. I get very sore balls of my feet when wearing any shoe, even those with a special insole in to support the metatarsal bones. However, with crocs, there is NO pain, ever. I live in crocs, indoors and outdoors. They are good on long walks. The downsodes? In winter, indoors my feet get a little cold, they're not as warm as slippers. They are slippy on ice. As the soles wear down, they get slippy on wet surfaces. Mine last about a year until the soles are very smooth but I still continue to wear them, just not on wet surfaces.They are easy to get on and using the strap, easty to keep on.Unlike cheap copies, the croc size matches my foot size perfectly.I now have loads of pairs of crocs and don't know what I would do if they stopped making them. I can't recommend these highly enough.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2010

Title: No good if you have plantar fasciitis
Review: I bought these because they were recommended by a physio who was treating my plantar fasciitis.  However, these shoes although seemingly very comfortable, provide no support at all for the foot.  I soon realised that my PF was getting far worse whenever I had worn the crocs and my ankles became incredibly sore.  I found the best shoes to wear are FitFlops which provide more support and give your calf muscles a workout which helps in the alleviation of PF symptoms.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 May 2019

Title: If God made shoes
Review: I have very wide feet and I weigh 99kg, Crocs are literally the only footwear I can find that's comfortable and doesn't aggrevate my hips and knees. That means I can go out, that means the world to me. Thank you so much
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 August 2020

Title: Same as always
Review: This is the fourth pair of crocs I've had. Once they've worn out (after 3 years of constant use), it is great to know that you can replace with the same old same old and they'll feel and fit just right
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 August 2020

Title: Strange fitting
Review: Whilst decent enough quality, I find the sizing a little strange. I am nowhere near a size 10 in normal shoes, but as others have found out, Crocs sizing bears only a passing semblance to regular shoes.These size 9 crocs are about the equivalent of a regular shoe size 8 1/2.I can't wear them with the back strap on, I have to wear them with the strap folded forward, out of the way, to stop my toes pushing against the front.Live and learn, next time I'll buy a size larger than my regular shoe size. :/
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 September 2014

Title: shoe snobbery at its worst, thinking most wearers have a screw loose
Review: For years I would turn my nose up at Crocs, shoe snobbery at its worst, thinking most wearers have a screw loose.  Then as I got older and the feet need more TLC, I decided to try them, and all I can say is, my feet are in heaven! They fit like a glove, maybe go a size down, otherwise you will need socks to pad them out. I wear them a lot now as they are so comfortable and leave your feet feeling relaxed.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 May 2017

Title: Best purchase ever
Review: I bought these crocs around a month ago for a two week holiday in Florida where I knew it was going to be hot, I was going to be walking a lot and for many hours at a time - theme park visiting, sightseeing, etc.Absolutely all shoes pretty much hurt my feet - from high heels to low heels, from sandals to flip flop or even trainers end up hurting me if I wear them for too long. Not these crocs!!! I wore them consistently, pretty much every day for ten days. My feet didn't sweat, which I thought would be an issue, and I didn't get any marks, blisters or wounds. They are so comfortable they will be indispensable in all my future holidays. Granted, you feel like you are walking around in your slippers (how cool is that??)and the design may not go with all your clothes, but if the alternative is to be in fashionable pain, who cares?Just one thing, though - Bijou Blue is slightly darker than I thought it would be, but still a nice colour. Mine are made in Italy and size 5 UK is perfect for me (I am a size 5 in the UK, 38 or 38 and a half in Spain). Only mentioning this because the sizes confused me a little :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 July 2012

Title: Comfortable Rubber Clogs - Better than the knock-offs.
Review: I had been dithering about buying Crocs for  a while as I liked the idea of them for pottering around in but all the ones I had tried in the supermarket (cheap immitation) were always so plasticky and uncomfortable.I am glad I finally took the plunge. They are firm but springy and feel pleasant to walk around on. Just what I was looking for really - just don't buy them for long walks or as everyday out of the house shoes - that's not what they're for!I am usually a size 11 or 12 (UK) and opted for size 11 as they are described as 'roomy fit'. They are juuust big enough but I suspect the 12s would have been too loose.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 May 2015

Title: Shrunk 3 sizes in a few weeks!
Review: These Crocs have shrunk by 3 sizes (!!) from being left out in the sun in the garden in Belgium. Iâ€™ve bought size 43 for my husband and after few weeks they suddenly shrunk to size 39-40 from just sitting on the terrace in the sun! My son has size 40 and they are slightly small even for him. I doubt these are genuine Crocs as the previous pair bought in the brand store never changed in 4 years of our life in Africa. Do not recommend them and highly disappointed!
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 July 2020

Title: Nice value for money
Review: We bought this to use instead of the flip flops at home that i keep destroying. They do their job pretty well. Comfortable, easy to clean and the size was almost right( we targetd a slightly larger one that in my case turn out to be exactly my number).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 June 2020

Title: Great price price crocs
Review: These are ok for my husband because he had a bandaged leg and foot do the extra width helps but if he was just with socks they would be a little on the big side but nevertheless a great price
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 September 2020

Title: True to size and comfortable
Review: These are very similar if not identical to almost all Crocs purchased in the past. They share the same large dimples across the inner sole and heel and a intermittent pattern to the outer sole and heel.The fit is true to size unlike those made in China which are about half a size undersize, hence the suggestion to buy a size larger than normal. The sole pattern is an all-over herringbone pattern and there is no separation between sole and heel.I normally get 18-24 months of wear from a pair, wearing them several hours a day 24/7.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 October 2014

Title: Size chart misleading
Review: I spent a fair amount of time checking through the size chart and making sure the size ordered was correct for my size. However,â€‹ when I got them it was instantly obvious these were way too large. So had to order another pair. Thankfully Amazon gave me a refund on these.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 July 2018

Title: mind the colour!
Review: I ordered these in "red" colour and in my laptop's screen it seemed reddish indeed, but when I received them I noticed colour was very pale, almost pink... there is a "tomato" version which is actually what most people would call "red", which I should have ordered if I had not been partially misled by my laptop's screen colours.These are just not red in my opinion!Also, your foot sweats more than expected in these, I thought it was an issue of the closed version but the holes do not help much from this perspective.A very good product, too bad I cannot ignore the above issues.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 September 2014

Title: Returned
Review: Way to big . Ordered my usual size and they were huge , to long and too wide , ordered the smaller size and they were to small , there was a big difference in sizes . I know loads of people love these but they were not for me . Also felt the hard raised nodules on the soles were very uncomfortable. They did come on time and well packaged .
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 September 2018

Title: Size problems  are sizes in US or UK ......You need to check
Review: Crocs...........I buy this type of footwear regularly  There seems to be a size issue with them I have previously bought size 11 only to find them too small so I used to order up size 12  This last order I ordered 12 only to find them too BIGsellers need to explain this US size 11 is smaller than UK size 11 Just check WHAT you are buying !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 June 2016

Title: Great
Review: Purchased for my husband who has size 15 feet! They fit perfectly. Have been worn to death and still look exactly the same. They are crocks! You purchase them because you know what your getting.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 September 2020

Title: good quality
Review: brilliant...ordered these for my elderly mum who has swollen feet and they fitted perfect and comfortable....quality is fantastic and price is right...i'll be ordering one for myself...my mum is a size 5 but because of swollen feet i ordered a size 6 (if that helps anyone)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 October 2017

Title: Good but a bit nobbly!
Review: I bought these in my usual size 7 but had to return them as they were too small. I ordered an 8 and they seem ok. I got them as a second pair to the comfy cheap imitation Crocs which I have worn to death and I thought I would treat myself to a pair of originals to see what all the fuss is about :) My only crit would be that they they are very nobbly under foot. I am wondering if this is supposed to stimulate circulation or something but I find it a bit irritating - I hope the pimpley nobles wear down as they make walking uncomfortable - perhaps someone could comment about that? Otherwise looking forward to using them to and from the hot tub on hols.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 September 2013

Title: Most comfortable footwear ever
Review: Bought to replace a pair I have had so long the soles were smooth and slippery! These are perfect, comfortable moments after putting on and now Iâ€™m less likely to slip on wet surfaces. Love my crocs and would recommend to anyone
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2019

Title: Great shoes.
Review: Ridiculously comfy, WeIl made and a good fit for my eee fit feet. I wore these throughout my pregnancy as my feet swelled during the summer and they were great. No, these are not your traditional office wear but I managed to get away with wearing them at work! It's worth noting that my husband hates them with a passion! They do get a bit pongy but they are so quick to wash and dry so it's not a problem.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 September 2017

Title: Bent straps
Review: This is unfortunately the second pair I have ordered from this seller. First paid had bent straps which did not sit correctly at the front of the crocs. This replacement pair has the same issue but even worse than the previous one. The crocs seem to have been put under some form of pressure maybe in the warehouse and therefore they have deformed shape. I will be returning this pair since I have seen a functional pair I know that the straps are not meant to be like this.
Size: Size: 7 UK Men/ 8 UK WomenColour: Lemon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2020

Title: Comfortable and breathable
Review: Liked the blue ,went with my scrubs for work , comfortable for a 12 hour shift and easily rinsed and dryed ,worth paying for crocs, cheaper version blistered my feet and wore thin quickly
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2020

Title: Another Choc in the family
Review: Bought for my partner as she keeps wearing mine into the garden. She's a size 3.5uk. The size 3-4 fits fine but if you were a uk size 4 maybe the size up would benefit !Overall they are great, the colour blue is very girly & perfect for lady's & teenaged youths.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Pool
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 October 2019

Title: Fit well
Review: Comfortable clogs,I use them in the caravan especially in the morning when the dog wants to nip out for a wee and the grass is wet,so handy to just slip these on.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 September 2020

Title: Good shoes - sizing can be confusing though
Review: Only with my third pair was I able to get a pair that fitted properly.  They are well made and much more comfortable than you might imagine.  You can walk in them for some distance easily.  Great at the beach.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2020

Title: Perfect fit
Review: Item was perfect, fit is spot on for me. I have crocs flip flops and as they fit perfectly I ordered the same size. Ideal in the garden in this weather. I would recommend them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 May 2020

Title: Bought as gift
Review: Bought these as a gift and the wearer described them as the most comfortable pair of shoes they have ever worn. Wears them all the time and lasting well. They might not be the most attractive items of footwear, but they serve their purpose. Very pleased with these.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 March 2019

Title: At least one size too big
Review: I ordered size 9 (UK sizes).  This i received, and the paperwork confirmed Size 9;  BUT after i'd worn them for a while, i discovered that they are in fact Size 10.  Which is OK, but it makes it easier to stumble
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 December 2019

Title: So comfy, so pinky ðŸ¥°
Review: Love them!! Even pinkier than I thought... just adorable!!Well worth paying extra for next day delivery. Saved me traipsing around uncomfortable. Thank you x
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 November 2020

Title: Too large and roomy for the stated size
Review: These are too large for a UK male size 8 fit. I swapped for a size 7 which are more like it. However, still too wide. These are ok for messing around for a while in the garden but not for walking any distance, the looseness of fit just makes them unsafe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 August 2019

Title: Great for outside
Review: The original item, perfect fit, my husband is a UK 7 in shoes and a UK 8 in trainers. Perfect for the garden and he said they are very comfortable too.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 September 2020

Title: Made in a different country
Review: I have previously purchased two black pairs of crocs from you the same size, they were made in Italy the newly purchased ones were made in China.  They are not as soft and the strap is longer.  I am not sure if the description said where they were made but it's something I will watch in future.  I use them for camping, in the garden and slippers hence three pairs.  They are ok but not as comfortable as the other two identical pairs.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 October 2013

Title: Our people's crocks!
Review: Well, my new crocks are deepest red and they are great. And unlike the ones I recently bought in a local shop that were made in China, these produced in Italy! Some of my relatives tease me that these look more pink than red, but my wife assures me otherwise. A great buy and much cheaper than the Chinese ones. So comfortable, a pleasure to wear. But a word of advice - might be best to test them out in a local shop so that you get the right size. The trick is to make sure they are spacious and that the heel strap clings well. I was a bit doubting at first but they do and are so comfortable on the feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2013

Title: Crocs, but with customer service
Review: The ultimate garden and pool shoe, a firm summer staple. The added bonus of buying this through amazon is much better customer service than buying from Crocs directly!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 June 2020

Title: Crocs Adult Classic Black
Review: This is my second pair now and this pair is different. My 1st pair were made in China and were great but have worn considerably on the sole in just under a year: about a month of outside wear and the rest inside; but no complaints as I do walk a lot of miles. My new  pair are made in Italy and fit slightly snugger {but more of a perfect fit). The material seems to be a better quality and I imagine will wear better than the Chinese...but of course time will tell.They are really good value and incredibly comfortable; perfect for indoors or for outside use.

Title: Soooo comfortable

I usually wear size 8 but after trying my first pair on in a shop, I only needed a size 7.I get Planta Faciatis (very painful feet after standing/walking for too long) and crocs are the only shoes I have found to alleviate this.  They seem to be the perfect shape and cushioning for supporting your arches and heels.  I live in them and worn my old ones out (just keep for in the garden now) so I would definitely recommend.

Title: So good you'll never take them off!!!

Title: Sizes are wrong and not made in Italy like the picture
Review: Product pictures show 'made in Italy' but the green ones I ordered were made in Vietnam!. I ordered a UK 10 (US11) and the paperwork says that too but the product has 11 on them and they are too big and too wide .Clearly the different countries are making to different specifications. The US sizing crocs I normally buy which are made in Italy show 2 sizes on the base(as per picture on the description of the product). The Vietnam ones  have one size on the base. Amazon should either buy all their crocs in from the same supplier (yes I bought direct from Amazon not the marketplace) so they are all the the same size. This was a gift so its very disappointing to have to return them. Gave 1 star as the delivery service was good.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 June 2018

Title: Fantastic

So easy just to slip these on and you can wash them. Really comfortable and great wearing. I have had these for months now and they get worn every day. They still look new!

Title: Bargain price and oh-so useful!
Review: I never thought I'd own a pair of Crocs, in fact I swore I wouldn't because they're ugly as sin!! But I dog sit in other peoples homes fairly often and got fed up of standing in hair and drool all the time. These plasticy 'clogs' are just awesome - i can just slip them on and trot around the house quite merrily! They don't slip off easily like flip flops can - especially when you use the bar thingy and they are VERY comfortable. I bought the black pair so as they didnt stand out too much - and I have to say (In the right situation) I have been converted - they're actually not as ugly as I thought!!

Title: Run small
Review: If I use the strap around the back of my foot they become very very small. They won't fit. If I put the strap over the top of the shoe they just fit. I got my usual size 5. They run small. I like the colour. I got pink.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2019

Title: Crocs are as good as ever, but why do sellers make it so difficult to order the right size?
Review: I've been wearing Classis Crocs for years. It's a comfort thing, and it's a versatiltiy thing: they're great for round the house, but they also work for long-haul flights, and even long haul walking over rought ground. I'm just back from an extended trip to New Zealand, with lots of walking, beach-bashing and even 4-day canoe expeditions: I hardly wore anything but my Crocs in 6 weeks, resorting to boots only on the highest mountain Ruapehu, a 9,100 foot volcano.But whenever I buy a new pair (you do waer them out eventually with that kind of treatment) I have to play a guessing game. The sellers insist on me ordering them in a UK size, then they guess whether I want the US size slightly bigger or slightly smaller, and I've noe idea which way they will jump, so half the time I have to send them back. PLEASE can I have the option to order the US size I actually want ... I do know ... it's written on the sole of the ones I'm wearing. Believe me, I know other people who have the same problem over and again, and at least one who is giving up on Crocs, despite the comfort, because they're fed up with the lousy internet site that forces this silly guessing game. Come on Crocs ... get a web designed with a little bit of common sense and put your current web team out to grass (wearing wellies).
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2014

Title: They are large as that is what I wanted to help my feet.

Title: Good Quality Genuine Product
Review: These are good quality genuine Crocs at an excellent price. Anyone who has tried them will know that they are extremely comfortable. They may not be your first choice for fashion, but my husband and I wear ours around the garden and also have a pair for slippers. I found these brilliant last year when suffering from a heel problem where I could hardly put my foot to the ground. Crocs were the only shoe that gave me some relief and comfort. They are also totally washable and I pop them in the washing machine when necessary. They are also great for taking camping and wearing in the showers.

These also seem to have more defiined bumpy inner which is not a problem as I think it probably gives my feet a bit of a masseage when walking! They can be washed and dried in a couple of minutes so are ideal for gardening, walking on the beach etc. I am using them as slippers around the house and notice that my legs tire less quickly than when wearing normal slippers.

Title: Comfortable, Waterproof and Easy

I bought them to go camping in France for wearing around the campsite/tent, slipping on for late night trips to the toilet, and generally ambling about. They are perfect for all these things. They are easy to slip on and off, they keep your feet surprisingly warm and they are comfortable straight out of the box. I would not wear them for long walks.Be warned: they should not be used for a fashion statement and they should not be decorated with little Croc trinkets. This behaviour will just make you look silly unless you are under 5 years of age.

However, width-wise, they felt too loose around my foot and wouldn't stay on unless I used the strap, which then pushed my foot forwards and squashed my toes. I wanted to use these as shoes/slippers to jump in and out of around the house, therefore they are no good for me and I will be returning them.

Title: genuine Crocs. Navy adult size 5
Review: I have worn crocs for caravaning and at home for 5 years, they are comfy without socks and easy to slip on and off. I bought these for my son to wear in the same way. they are brilliant value for money. I do not think as them as a substitute for shoes but unlike the cheaper inferior ones do not harm your feet. When worn the heat from your feet moulds crocs to be a comfortable and good supportive fit, you can wear them on the beach as the holes allow any water to drain. Hence why the boating, caravanning and nurses have worn them for years.

Title: comfort wonder!!

I also put these on as soon as I get out of bed as previously I was unable to stand correctly on my right foot due to the pain it causes, as soon as I slip on my crocs the pain goes and I have no problem walking.  Would recommend these to anyone who has foot problems as they mould to your feet and offer instant relief.  I now have four pairs. They may not be the nicest looking shoe in the world but right now my comfort comes first!!

Title: Not genuine Crocs

After ordering these I decided to pay the Â£10 extra and order from the official Crocs website and whilst they look almost identical, these ones are a harder, plastic-style material whereas the genuine Crocs are more malleable and rubbery (and therefore higher quality). I'm sure these are fine but it's definitely worth spending slightly more for the real thing.
