Title: Super value
Review: Bought them for my Husband, who goes through a lot of slippers. Great that you can easily wash these. Did not think he would like them, as he is kind of set in his ways. However, he surprised me by saying he found them very comfortable. I think the only thing he has never really liked, is the fact they have a very wide toe. That's his preference though. Would definitely buy again and am thinking of getting some for myself in a different colour..
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2015

Title: Pretty good croc overall
Review: When they arrived had US size and frowned and thought too big. But they are the right size - certainly generous rather than tight making them super cool for summer!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 June 2020

Title: Great Product
Review: I like the product as it is an easy slip on/slip off style allowing the freedom of walking barefoot but not having to stop and put shoes on if you just want to pop outside.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 September 2019

Title: Okay, but...
Review: I bought these Crocs because I have other colours which I love, but these black ones appear to be of inferior quality.  The plastic is a lot harder and ungiving and therefore not nearly as comfortable.  Maybe they will soften in time, but I see no reason why a different colour should be any different in quality, especially as the price remains the same and I suspect these are manufactured by a different company, using cheaper materials.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 April 2015

Title: Brilliant Present
Review: As a comedic present to my partners dad, it went from ironic to his favourite shoe - god, Ilove crocs!
Size: Size: 7 UK Men/ 8 UK WomenColour: Bronze
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 September 2020

Title: Comfy Crocs
Review: Bought them for myself but ended up giving them to my nephew who needed a new pair.  He loved them, wouldn't let me take them off his feet!  Crocs clogs are wide fitting in general and he has wide feet, so they were comfortable for him.  Good buy.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Chocolate
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 October 2018

Title: Great fit
Review: I have trouble with shoes, having an artificial leg one foot is a bit thinner and I'm sure a tad smaller than the real one. Last time I ordered a size twleve (not original crocs) which wore too loose, and became dangerous for me. I must admit I was dubious about buying these, but am so glad I did. They fit perfectly and I love them.Brilliant real crocs, fitted well (perfectly), very happy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 April 2016

Title: Sizing an issue. Also, the plastic moulding is not perfect. Is this a genuine Croc?
Review: I have given the seller 5* because the reaction time was very good. I received the next size up the day I returned the original Croc. The sizing is very disappointing. UK5 was what I wanted, but it was too tight. UK6 is too big.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Chocolate
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 April 2019

Title: Red Crocs
Review: I take a 6.5 shoe and the size 6 was too 'short' the width was fine but the length of the croc is definitely a size 6. The 7 is slightly too long so I have to wear the heel strap. They are very lightweight and very good to wear - not a fashion statement, I have resisted joining the croc brigade but I have been won over by the men in my life wearing crocs and me 'sneakily' slipping theirs on to go out in the garden. I did try cheaper brands but they are exactly-that poor imitations.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 March 2014

Title: Great invention
Review: Crocs are just fabulous ! This is my 3rd pair in different colours so I think that says it all. Light and easy to wear, I use them as slippers for indoors as well as going into the garden,popping to the local shop and as a poolside slip on. I wouldn't be without a pair.  I pop them in the shower with me when they look dusty, my daughter has even popped them in the washing machine. Her husband put them in the tumble dryer( WHY?) not a good move, they wouldn't fit me after and I am 2 sizes smaller!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 June 2013

Title: I COULDN'T CONTINUE WORKING WITHOUT THEM
Review: crocs saved my life!  well, my choice of employment, anyway.  i have been working on yachts as a chef (etc., etc.) for 25 years, and i'm on my feet between 12 and 20 hours per day.my feet were always painful, no matter what i wore to begin with.  but you live with it.  however, after the first 5 years, my legs and feet started to swell if we had guests on the boat for longer than 2-3 weeks in a row...eeek!  i really thought i would have to retire, as we started having people for more than 5 weeks.  no amount of drugs, infusions or snatched rest with my feet above my head helped.then along came a friend of ours, who had gotten himself a captain's job on the boat owned by the owners of crocs.  he was giving these shoes away.  we all said, NO, THEY ARE TOO UGLY!  he said, TRY THEM.  i did.and i've never looked back!i now own more than 5 pairs of all kinds, and some are not even ugly!but these, my "cooking shoes," (which i'm wearing now!) are the best things on the planet, i don't care what they look like!thanks, crocs!  i'm your biggest fan.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 June 2014

Title: Very happy with these Crocs
Review: I purchased these Crocs as a gift for my 80 year-old mother. She finds the fit very comfortable and the material and the shape of them makes her feel very sturdy on her feet while she walks. This is the third pair she owns and she doesn't wear anything else most days.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2020

Title: I'm 18 years old... I'm in love
Review: OH MY GOODNESS? Honestly I'm a size 8/9 (depending on the type of shoe) and I ordered a size 7 because all of the reviews said to order down a size, they really fit like a glove! They are so comfortable, I want them to be some kind new fashion trend just so I can wear them out without shame. Really though I'm a person who likes dressing for comfort instead of style; and I couldn't of found a better piece of footwear!Only negatives I would have to point out is that all of my flat mates have rejected me XD
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2014

Title: Great colour Great Fit
Review: I am a size UK 7 women's wide foot and this classic Croc is perfect width wise and length.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 May 2019

Title: great shoe
Review: Didn't think I'd ever wear a croc but wife bought for using in garden and I wear everywhere now!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 August 2020

Title: TOO BIG TO BE COMFORTABLE
Review: I BOUGHT THESE CROCS AND THE UNISEX BAYA CLOG TO COMPARE FIT. I BOUGHT THEM BOTH IN A 5 AFTER TRYING THESE ON IN A LOCAL SHOP & FINDING THESE A BETTER FIT THAN THE 6 CONSIDERING I USUALLY WEAR A 5.5 TO 6. BUT FOUND EVEN THE 5 WAS NOT A COMFORTABLE FIT, WHEREAS THE CLOG STYLE SHOE WAS. ALSO MADE MY FEET LOOK LIKE BOATS!!AM UNSURE WHAT THE SIZING ON THE BOTTOM OF THE SHOE IS & EVEN THE SHOP STAFF COULDN'T HELP ME. THEREFORE, THESE WERE SENT BACK.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 May 2014

Title: Uk 8 fits my uk 8 foot!
Review: I havenâ€™t worn them on a big walking trip yet so canâ€™t comment on rubbing or comfort after wearing them for a long time- but I know there is a lot of confusion over size! Iâ€™m an womenâ€™s uk 8 - I chose the size that said women uk 8 and they are fine! Hope this helps someone!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 May 2018

Title: Careful with size
Review: Be careful when ordering, the size is men's first, womens second, picker will choose mens size even for women.?????
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 September 2020

Title: Gardening and lounging
Review: Crocs are so comfy, slip them on inside or out, if recommend a pair for each. Very comfy with either socks or without.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Lemon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 June 2020

Title: Indestructable, and really comfy
Review: I think that kids should be allowed to wear crocs for school, they are completely indestructable.  My son took these on holiday last May and has worn them all summer and then through the winter to nip out in the garden etc.  They are just brilliant and given the choice he wouldn't wear anything else on weekends we normally have the conversation of 'can I wear my crocs?'
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 April 2016

Title: Comfy footwear
Review: I have had mine a good while now and really love them, great for around the house, going to training and for short works (not ideal for long walks or terrain that requires stability), they wash well and dry quickly, both myself and my wife wear these alot.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 April 2018

Title: Comfortably great shoes
Review: I have been a fan of crocs for years but had let my collection run down as they gradually wore out. However, I saw these at a good price so bought them...then after about two-weeks foot-enjoyment bought another identical pair.I have never found a pair of shoes that are instantly so comfortable. I have a wide foot and they are perfect for me. These, I am pleased to say, are made in Italy rather than China, so seem to be evidence of a return of manufacturing to the EU. As a Brit I would like to see them made in the UK, of course!Downside to the shoes? The holes in the front let in small stones on the beach, and when the soles wear they become very slippery. Best to use them as slippers at that stage...
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 September 2013

Title: Another comfortable pair of Crocs
Review: As a Croc regular these are as comfortable and practical as those that went before.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2020

Title: Love the colour!
Review: I read all the reviews befor buying these, my first pair of crocs, and took the advise to buy a size larger as these were made in China and were a bit on the small side.  However when they arrived they were made in Italy!  Not sure if a size smaller would have been too small though. There's plently of room, and they fit better with the strap around the heel. Wore them this morning with thin socks and they were fairly snug.  I bought these crocs because I've had a pair of bargain "Fitflops" sandals from a charity shop the past year, which are very comfortable, but wanted something for the cooler days that I could wear with or without socks and couldn't afford the fitflop clogs.Overall these crocs fit the bill - well priced - comfortable - love the colour!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 June 2014

Title: Excellent fit! Highly recommend.
Review: Brilliant product, would definitely recommend. Perfect fit at a good price. Arrived next day as expected. Hope they last 7 years like my last ones did.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2020

Title: Perfect! As expected
Review: Absolutely love them! Went a size smaller, as with all crocs and they fit like a glove. And everyone at work comments on the colour. As bright as in the picture! :-D
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 August 2020

Title: Very good
Review: I work 12hr shifts at the hospital and obviously on my feet all day . Very comfy and sturdy.  Like the nobbly bits inside gives good grip for the soles of your feet

Title: Love 'em

Title: No socks needed!

Title: Crocs
Review: Well made, used as slippers, keep feet cool, comfy, can wear out!  None slip, second pair, first make we're holy sole or something like that and lasted over ten years, I wore everyday and on holidays and in sea. Crocs are better quality and for Â£17 can't go wrong, been looking to replace my old ones for years and  Â£30 plus every where glad I waited for price drop to more than half, well looks like crocs aren't getting another sale from me for another 10 years hopefully.

Title: Love my Crocs

Title: Genuine Crocs Rock

Title: a great multi use shoe
Review: These are comfortable versatile shoes which you can wear on the beach or around the house or doing a spot of gardening in, they can be washed under the tap so it doesn`t matter how dirty you get them. the shoe is quite a soft rubber/plastic material so it absorbs shock so your feet are less likely to ache with fatigue, one thing to note the sizes are a little bigger than normal, i bought these for my girlfriend who normally takes a size 6 but she has a size 5 in crocs which fit her perfectly.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black

Title: Classic croc

Title: Wish I'd purchased sooner.
Review: After trying my sisterâ€™s, I just had to order a pair for myself as they were so comfy! I donâ€™t buy shoes for looksâ€¦comfort all the way! My crocs arrived today, I only planned to wear them to the bin or the corner shop (convenient slip on shoes)â€¦I have not removed them from my feet since I put them on!! They are so comfy, taken them up town and beyond, still on me now in the house (don't wear shoes inside). Will be ordering a secondary pair ASAP because no doubt I will burn these babies right through in no time! Seriously happy!

Title: Incorrect sizing
Review: I read various reviews about crocs before ordering, and gathered from most that the sizings can be hit or miss. I therefore ordered two different styles and two different sizes.Jolly glad that i did. My normal size is a 6, but the size 6 that i ordered looked more like a childs shoe. There was no way my feet were going to fit into those. The pair i ordered in a different size and style fitted perfectly. My advice for this product would be to either order two pairs in different sizes or go for 2 sizes bigger than you would normally wear.

Title: Great purchase!

Title: I'm annoyed at how much I like them
Review: I begrudgingly bought them as my hospital brought in new infection control rules because of covid. They're annoying comfortable and practical.

Title: Highly reccommended

Title: A convert!

Title: Crocs

Title: Average. Not great support to arches
Review: Weird fitting, make sure youâ€™re getting a womanâ€™s size not a menâ€™s. And I would get a size smaller.Also the arch support is not great, wearing all day in hospital setting and when I take them off I feel such relief to put on a pair of trainers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 May 2020

Title: Otherwise they are the most comfortable summer shoes I've ever bought
Review: These are my fifth pair of Crocs - and exactly as I expected. Having heard some adverse comments about Crocs, It is very important  to discard them when the soles wear flat as they can become dangerous in wet conditions. Otherwise they are the most comfortable summer shoes I've ever bought. The fit is important as they should always be a bit big - as advised in the original Crocs fitting guide.JUDITH MACBETH
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2014

Title: I love my new fuchsia clogs!
Review: Crocs may be ugly, but they are enormously comfortable and practical. Crocs are my preferred every day footwear. This is the 6th pair of Crocs that I've bought in the last 6 years. The soles do wear smooth eventually and become dangerously slippery on wet surfaces, so worn out Crocs must be binned and replaced. Crocs are great for the beach, sailing, camping, gardening and anywhere where your feet might get wet. Many naturists wear them on the beach or at their club sites. I love my new summery fuchsia Crocs!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 July 2012

Title: Size too big but good quality and good price...old man now wears them
Review: I got these for holiday & had to get another pair a size down,for some reason getting the right size croc is a bit of a headache...my brother liked mine so he bought some whilst on our hols for 3x the price,they are comfy & perfect for lounging about the beach in

Title: Love these!

Title: Good.

Title: Very big

Title: Very pleased with purchase

Title: First class.
Review: I have only had my Crocs for a few weeks, but cannot find fault. Smart, comfortable and feel like the real deal.I have found them to be cool - you can actually feel the air circulating around your feet. That is a lovely feeling. However also warm, when it goes chilly.  The bump pattern, on the internal sole, provides a lovely sensation. No sign of wear and tear yet, but I cannot say how these will last.So far I am a very happy purchaser.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 September 2012

Title: Soooo Comfortable
Review: Bought these as a birthday present for my father who suffers from chronic athritis in the feet. These shoes offer great arch support and therefore help ease the discomfort / aches & pains in the feet. In addition to this, they can obviously be worn in a whole host of scenarios; beach, sea, garden etc etc. They might not be the most attractive looking show, but they are so comfortable and very good value for money. They're hard wearing - I've had a pair for well over a year, which still look like new. Go on, give them a try!
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy

Title: Comfy Crocs

Review: I bought some of the crocs ten years ago and have worn them nearly every day since and they are still comfortable and going strong, although a little worn (not much though). Title: Soooo comfortable!
Review: I love crocs, and have a variety (including the wonderful lined ones for winter wear). Their springy footbed makes them so comfortable, they're easy to keep on with or without the heel straps, and easy to keep clean. Title: I shall have to return them. Too loose/sloppy fit ...

It's a pity the advertisements do not make these subtle differences clear. I should have chosen a "baha" style fit apparently.

Title: Misleading size = unhappy customer

There's no substitute for trying something on BEFORE buying it.

Title: As good as anyone says about them, no-one is exaggerating!
Review: I saw someone wearing a pair of Crocs Cayman, and liked the look - they recommended them, and although I had to keep trying to get a big enough size, I am a size 5 but had to go to 7 to get the width for me, I was thrilled.  The huge size does NOT look odd at all, and I have kept on getting more of the Cayman and the Baya - nice thing about Baya Watermelon, is that is has a metallic-like sheen - just a small comment!! I now have got 8 pairs, various colours from sensible to crazy, to indulge myself indoors!!  They do not slide off - I wear as clogs, strap over top, as I am unable to bend down to put on shies.  I do not have to worry about them slipping off, and they really are non-marking.  I find that they do not show scuffs as mushc as one person said, and I got some "Crocs Butter" anyhow, to wipe them if they get really scuffed or damaged.  They are fine in winter and summer, I have worn jeans socks inside them, but that was a bit o.t.t. and did stretch the pair after a while, but not enough to bother about.  Fine supermarket cotton socks are perfect if you need a bit of warmth or to hide unsightly ankles, like me. The only problem I have is one that demonstrates how GOOD they are: I have a bit of a job to "kick them off" at the door!  This shows how well they grip your feet, without you realising it.  They crease when kneeling or crouching, but the crease fades if left for a couple of days, unlike with leather shoes.  The best buy I have made in all my long life of shoes (having real problem feet - they are shaped like a duck!) No wonder our hospital staff wear them - on hard floors they are a cushion, on carpet they are like a soft mattress!  Amazon - I ought to have said to start with - delivery long before expected, absolutely NO problems with returning or queries, the best service I have received ever, and I do mean that.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2010

Title: don't know what I'd do without them.....
Review: I remember the first pair of Caymans I bought; I stood in the shop, looking down at my Croc-clad feet and I said to the shop owner "God they're ugly...". He didn't take offence because after all he didn't design them but he did cautiously say "well they are very popular".Right ok then, because I needed something to wear around the house and there was no way I was ever going to allow anyone other than my husband and children to see me wearing them anyway.I'm on my second pair now, because after about 2 years of intense use the soles were worn smooth. I wear them all the time, indoors and out, school runs, beach, pool, supermarket. As anyone who owns a pair will know they are just sooooooo comfortable! The clunky look has grown on me and it's a bit of a cult thing isn't it? Besides, beauty's only skin deep and if you like your feet you'll give them Crocs, style be damned.The only thing I will say, in the hope that the Croc people might read this, is that I would love a selection of different designs colour-wise i.e. marbled or tie dye, in the adult sizes.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2010

Title: Crocs Adult Cayman
Review: Great purchase. Had a bursa on my achilles tendon making any shoes impossible to wear. Have worn these every day this summer they are so comfortable. Many thanks to Amazon for dealing so fast and efficiently with the pathetic Royal Mail next day by 1pm delivery service. I waited until midday and then saw on the Royal Mail tracking site that they had already been delivered and if I didn't have them they must be at a neighbour's house! Tried the obvious neighbours, no, so we went out and came back to find.............a sorry you were not in card! Phoned up and complained and they arranged for a next working day delivery before 1pm. Didn't arrive again and the web site said they had been delivered at 7.31 am!! And this time nobody was answering the phones because of industrial action. Told Amazon the next day and they sent me a new pair, no quibbles, which arrived the next morning. Thanks Amazon. I have emailed and written complaints to the Royal Mail and have received...........no reply.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2009

Title: Crocs Cayman clog

It is strange that two pairs of the same make of shoe should vary in sizing, but we noticed that they are made in different countries, which may have something to do with it.  Rather annoying!

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2010

Title: Fit as Expected After Research of the Brand
Review: When I first tried these shoes on I thought that they were too large. I'm a female who takes a UK 6.5 so I ordered the size 6men's/7female's. This size has actually turned out to be the correct size after having researched the way this particular model of these shoes should fit - I looked on the Crocs website (see pictures).  I would recommend that if you are unsure of what size to buy that you buy two pairs - after all one can always go back. These shoes are very roomy...and are supposed to be that way. They have space at the back, front and round the sides. They feel loose at first but after an hour or two of wearing them at home they were fine and even began to conform to the shape of my feet.  if you prefer a more regular fit I suggest getting a smaller size than usual.  Overall I am happy with purchase and would recommend Crocs to anyone.  They are lightweight and suportive.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 December 2015

Title: "Crocs"
Review: These adult Crocs are just great.My partner wore them all the 2 weeks we were in Florida-both in the water and just walking about - they are excellant-and far superior to the fakes you can get ( obviously! )Definitely worth the reasonable money!! Will buy again and always from  "Amazon"
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2009

Title: Crocs are great!
Review: This is the fifth pair of Cayman Crocs I now own and I love them and so does my 4 yr old daughter.  They are so comfortable and easy to slip on and off, lovely on your feet. I also ordered a pair for my 14 yr old son who claimed he hated Crocs until he 'borrowed' mine to pop into the garden recently.  He now loves them too.  As my husband felt left out he too has invested in a pair. He wasn't sure at first but likes them now too!!!
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 June 2010

Title: BLISS
Review: I've lived with chronic back pain for over 30 years and finding comfortable summer footwear has always been a problem. I've tried lots of different summer shoes and sandals, including Scholl, but none that were comfortable enough to wear all day.Friends who wear Crocs have said they'd be the only shoes they'd wear if they could but I didn't think they'd be any good for me, they look so uncomfortable. But this year I decided to try them, after all I had nothing to lose I could always return them. I chose the Classic Clog because this was the style I'd seen friends wearing.Well, I have to say I was stunned when I put them on, it was like magic, I've never had slippers feel this good to wear. One reviewer said she forgot she'd got them on and nearly went to bed with them on. I thought this was probably an exaggeration but I owe her an apology because you really do forget you've got them on and I nearly did the same.I wear them nearly all the time now, the only time I don't wear them is when it's raining or very cold.At last I have a pair of shoes that allow my feet to 'breathe' on hot days and that don't increase my pain when I wear them all day, aaahh BLISS.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 May 2013

Title: A bit dissapointed
Review: Crocs are my favourite shoes i have been buying them for years, we hada nice little Croc shop in Meadowhall that i used all the time until it closed recently :(So i decided to order a pair of Crocs from Amazon they arrived quickly but when i tried them on felt a little tight even though i had ordered the size i have worn comfortably for years, i decided to keep the as i thought that they must give as my other pairs have always been so comfy from the start, anyway they are still tight and feel a size smaller than the ones i nomally wear even though it says there the same size so i have returned to wearing my old pair as these just dont feel right :(
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 February 2012

Title: Size 10 Crocs
Review: Size 10 Crocs review.I bought these as the I lost the ones I got from Primark, which were much cheaper, I tried to buy some more there but they did not have any.These are a touch pricey, I was thinking of returning them as they did initially feel a bit small, but I kept them and glad I did.  They are not as light as those from Primark. But not a major problem.They are very comfortable, go on buy them, only real downside is the price.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 April 2012

Title: Converted to Crocs !!!!!!!!
Review: Well, where to start , hmmm......  Well, I was amazed how quickly they were delivered, many thanks !I have only recently discovered Crocs,  and I can honestly say that they are the BEST things I have ever worn on my feet !  I suffer with plantar spur tendonitis ( whatever it's called.. or policeman's heel ),  and these Crocs are the only footwear which relieves my pain and discomfort.  They even help my knees too,  because I can walk properly in Crocs.  I splashed out and bought a pair of work Crocs too, and I can now get through my 12 hour shifts in the care sector without being on  my hands and knees , nor hobbling like I'm crippled !!  With my work Crocs, because they're not vented and I have been blessed with the world's most sweaty feet, I do have to wear a little pair of trainer socks so my feet don't slip about in them.I was concerned about some previous reviews saying that the Crocs seems to be smaller sized ,  but my size 5's are perfect !!I wear Crocs all the time , round the house, walking the dog- even in muddy fields, it feels so funny to have the mud squelching round your feet and toes, then just swill your feet in the nearest puddle or stream !! lol !!  Perfect on rough terrain too.Bung them in the washer if they get smelly or dirty... and just shove them straight back on your feet, no need to wait for them to dry !  Irritating stones in shoes just find their way out again.I am totally converted to Crocs, for the comfort and practical reasons.  The first time I wore them, I was concerned that the nubs would make my feet sore, but nope, they don't.  A little piece of heaven for my feet.  !!!!!!
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Neon Magenta
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 July 2014

Title: My new purple crocs
Review: I am a size 6.5 and have bought Crocs before and bought W6/M8. However, the Crocs I have purchased in the past were made in China but as they are on the large size but fitted me. So I ordered a pair of size 6,only to find that they were too small! This is because they were made in Mexico and are the correct sizing. So if you're a size 6.5 be sure to order size 7!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 July 2013

Title: Hmmm!
Review: I've always fancied a pair of crocs so decided to go for them as they seemed such a reasonable price. The colour was fab but these were enormous. I'm a size 7-8 depending on who's footwear it is, I would actually recommend going down a size. I have sent them back and asked for a refund, seller very helpfully and very quick in refunding payment. I would actually deal with them again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 June 2013

Title: crocs adult clasic black
Review: just received my crocs today,and to say that i'm pleased with them would be an understatement,this is my first pair of crocs so i wasn't sure what to expect having previously put off buying them due to the way they look,but they are so light and comfortable that i havent taken mine off since i received them first thing this morning and i can honestly say that i recomend them 100%,so if the look of these is putting you off i recomend that you go ahead and buy them anyway,i prommise you wont be disappointed,i like these so much in fact that i'm about to buy another pair for my friends birthday,a truly first class product with a first class service to boot.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 April 2012

Review: These crocs are of the usual good quality, but I found them to be a little on the small side. I kept them but they started to rub my toes after wearing them for a couple of hours so I gave them to my daughter who takes a size smaller than me and they fit her perfectly, so be warned! Take my advice and order a size bigger.

Title: Reliable and fast service
Review: Crocs are great and the service was very fast.They arrived in the next 3 working days. Very good price and service.I would use them again!

Title: Are these genuine Crocs?
Review: I have owned 3 pairs of Crocs over the years. I purchased these and they felt they were made of inferior material to my previous pairs. I returned them to Amazon and the replacement Crocs were just the same. The rubber is harder and jars the feet when walking in them, so I have to question if these are genuine Crocs?
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 June 2013

Title: Size warning
Review: Ordered UK size 6 and received ones with a label saying 5.5. Amazon were quick to replace the item and the next pair had a label saying size 6. However, the sizing on the bottom of the Crocs was identicle to the original pair sent so they were no different to the pair I returned. I would strongly recommend future customers to purchase a half size bigger than required if u always buy the same size shoe i.e. I always take a 6 so I need  a 6.5 in these for them to be comfortable. I have obviously kept the item as it has been delivered as ordered but I don't think they'll get much wear! It would be good if the company made people aware of the possible sizing issues.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 July 2014

Title: Purple!
Review: I ordered my normal size but these are a bit on the big side so probably could have gone smaller. Also they aren't as dark purple as they look its more brighter but hey purples purple so am overall happy. Arrived before date stated so thanks for that :-)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 June 2013

Title: .....not happy ..
Review: i wore lots of crocs shoes ..... and comparing this to the one i bought in soccerworld this is one is pale in comparison ... the size is a bit small ,and the materials use was a bit hard ( not comfy) .... this is made in mexico and the one i bought in soccerworld is made in italy ...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 June 2013

Title: Great product but on the big side for size stated...
Review: These are very sturdy sandals, well made and colourful BUT I had to return them as they were too large for the size stated for me.  I don't know why this is as I have purchased many pairs of Crocs previously and always found them to me spot on for the size.  I returned them (Amazons return service is very easy to local shop) and went back to my usual Shayna Mary Janes which are great!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 July 2013

Title: Too big
Review: I bought these in a UK size 6 and they are massively too big. I have kept them as I only use them in the back garden to pop out water the plants and feed the rabbit or get to the garage. I love the colour though and they are comfortable.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 August 2013

Title: not a total crock...
Review: i suffer from plantar fasciitis,working on a concrete floor in an engineering plant...the boots they supply us are rarely a good fit, or comfortable long-term....i was advised to try these by a friend who used to do nursing.now wearing them all day long at home,pottering in the garden,garage,driving...sooo comfy,wide fitting ,(you first think they will fall off continually),recommended :),only wish they did steel toecap version to wear at work...p.s.,shop around well,mine were Â£17 inc.p&p,some places charging at least double that...yours, comfortably smug..,jinx
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 January 2015

Title: I am sending them back
Review: They are not like the classic crocs we are used to. They are too wide on the heel. I would say they are as widw as the front part. Therefore the strap is smaller. They are not comfortable.  I didn't notice this in the photo they show in the page. I am going to return them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 June 2013

Title: First Crocs - very comfortable
Review: These are my first Crocs. I wanted shoes for wearing around the house during the better weather - comfortable but easy to slip on and off. These Crocs definitely fit those requirements. Straight away I could feel the solid support in the soles. I wear them without the support strap in place at the back.Size wise I normally take a UK 11. I found it a bit confusing when choosing a size. At the time Amazon automatically suggested the Crocs unisex size M10/W11 as they know I normally wear UK 11. Confusingly in the drop down menu there was an option for UK 11 aswell. I had to compare the different sizes on Amazon, Crocs UK and Crocs Europe. I ended up going with UK 11 as it corresponded to the European size 46 which I get in Ecco shoes.Also note on the Crocs website they have different fittings. The ones I received were a 'roomy fit'.This is the data with my shoes - Amazon were the direct seller:Size: unisexUS: m12Euro: 46-47UK: m11/m12Roomy fitMade in Italy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 April 2016

Title: the fit is perfect and extremely comfortable
Review: After having read several reviews from people who had had crocs, I ordered my first ever pair, when they arrived I noted the country of origin (as had been mentioned in a few of customers reviews) and mine were made in Italy, the fit is perfect and extremely comfortable. I have a broad foot with a high instep and an arthritic joint at the base of one big toe, but these crocs are a really comfortable wear. I cannot recommend them highly enough. Brilliant!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 June 2015

Title: Hated it
Review: Can't think why so many people love these, I hated them, hated the nubbles under your feet, the inflexibility of them, hated everything about them!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 August 2013

Title: Keep trying to find the right fit
Review: I have tried a few different styles of clogs but returned to the classic to get the right length and width. In a shoe I take a UK size 7, but the recommended M6/W7 was too small so I picked the M7/W8 and they feel just like my original clogs slightly wider and longer that I would have in a shoe but great in a clog. These clogs are made in Italy and have 8 and 10 on the sole which I assume means M8 /W10 but it is very difficult to understand the sizing of crocs as they are made in several different countries which all have different sizes to the UK shoes. Trying them seems to be the only way of getting the right fit.

I like that I can wear them with or without socks and that they can be washed. If I purchase them again I will consider getting one size up, or half size if they do half's.

Title: Not Happy
Review: I suffer from plantar fasciatis in both heels and was recommended these crocs by a friend who had suffered from the same ailment and got great relief from this type of shoe.  Within half an hour of putting them on I was in complete agony and spent several hours afterwards off my feet as I was unable to even hobble, never mind walk.  Needless to say I was very disappointed as I expected to be able to walk easier and relatively pain free once I wore them.  However, they did arrive in excellent time and were comfortable once I put them on, shoe size, width etc. was spot on.  My problems only began once I actually started to walk in them.  Perhaps this type of shoe helps mild plantar fascitis but it is definitely not good for the more debilitating type.  I would recommend these shoes only for people who do not suffer from pain in their feet.

Title: Here is some size guidance for buyers based on my experience!
Review: I did select the size I wanted luckily, but I found the way the sizes are written in the option list potentially confusing and I would think other potential buyers might find the same! So, to help future buyers, you may find it useful to know that I am a ladies 6.5UK size and I selected "6 UK (M)/ 7 UK (W)" from the size options listed, which was just right. So ladies who are only just a size 6 might find the size "5UK(M)/ 6UK (W)" a better fit. For those of you who have bought Crocs previously, and know what Crocs size fits you as labelled on the sole, you might also find it helpful to know that the sole of the "6 UK (M)/ 7 UK (W)" Crocs I bought actually says "7M  9W". I therefore presume that the size listed as 5 UK (M)/ 6 UK (W) says "6M  8W" on the sole, and so on. The Crocs I received are made in Italy.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 August 2015

Title: New Crocs to replace my old ones
Review: Ordered these in the size i had had before and made sure that they came from Italy but when the size 4 came were much too small. Returned for a size 5 exchange was very easy and replacement ones came quickly, but i HATE them. I measured them against my old ones which now have hardly any tread on them as i have worn them to death and they seemed the same size however wore them for a week on holiday as felt fine for a couple of days but then they rubbed and i have HUGE blisters on the sides of my heel and little toe. The next size up would be much too big and i never had this problem with my old ones, so as i have worn them for a week will try them again when my feet have healed up and if they are still as uncomfy will bin them. Very disappointed as i loved my old crocs and expected these to be as comfy so dont know what the problem is.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 June 2013

Title: UK Sizing Incorrect
Review: These genuine Crocs were not a UK size 12 as advertised and as per the Crocs label.  I have been buying my Dad size 12 Crocs for years without any problem with the sizing.  His Crocs that fit have the number 12 on the sole.  These had a number 13 on the sole but the label clearly stated "UK 12".  They were too big.  My Dad has mobility issues and having shoes that fit is imperative to his being able to walk safely and confidently.  Unfortunately I could not return as I trusted the label which I had removed and had written my Dad's name on (he lives in a care-home).  This has put me off buying genuine Crocs on-line.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 April 2017

Title: Shrunk
Review: My husband previously bought a pair of crocs and we left them by the garden gate to use in the garden. Unfortunately, they shrunk! Size 8 became size 6 (mine are size 5, they are slightly bigger than mine) so there is no way that my husbandâ€™s feet can be fitted in. But they were comfortable, so I decided to buy him a new pair, bigger than his normal size! However, when he had a try, they were just about the right size for my husbandâ€™s feet! I didnâ€™t want to have a pair of size 7 in 1-2 years of light use, so I had to return them and buy an even bigger pair! So complicated! Not very happy.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 October 2020

Title: Amazon asked me how I liked this product
Review: I don't like this product. I hate this product. Along with Onesies they are my most hated clothing items. My brother however, wanted them for Christmas so I bought them for him. I'm considering disowning him.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 December 2013

Title: Very comfy!
Review: I bought these for my boyfriend for his holiday. He kept wearing mine last time and so I thought only fitting to get him some. They were very comfortable for him and he had quite a few colour choices too. He even wore them back in the UK on hot days! People say they aren't fashionable, but my goodness they are so comfy. It's like walking with flexible and comfortable polystyrene on your feet. They're so light, you forget that you're walking with shoes on.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 January 2020

Title: Great quality, comfort & durability
Review: Loved these from the moment I bought them. They have very good support and are quite hard wearing. I mostly wear them as slippers, with a few trips outdoors and they are still going strong.Pattern on the sole has worn, but there is still plenty of padding between me and the floor. I also find them quite warm. They are better than other slippers I have used in that they have air holes, so my feet don't get overly hot in the house. Very comfortable and long lasting.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 September 2019

Title: Inconsistent sizes - buy in a real shop
Review: This is the 3rd pair of Crocs I have bought online. Always same size, for my father and myself. However, this time, although the specs are exactly the same (as shown on the soles) the crocs are 2 cm shorter than previous pairs. We only noticed this fault when I gave the crocs as a gift to my dad, who lives overseas. It is frustrating and embarrassing. Also, it is very inconvenient to bring the crocs back to the UK, ship them back, etc. Very poor experience due to these nonsensical, inconsistent sizes. My advice: buy your Crocs in a normal retail store, as Amazon has proved unreliable in relation to sizes.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 December 2012

Title: Suddenly I see what the fuss is all about
Review: Previously I've been left nonplussed by the appeal of Crocs. I have long, narrow feet, with high arches, and every pair I ever tried on were just plain old uncomfortable. I'd long since given up hope of finding a pair that were comfortable enough for me to wear for more than three minutes. They always felt too tight or like they were about to fall off or too short or...Then I tried on a pair of these, and was surprised and impressed by how comfortable they were. I have to have the strap round the back of my foot, but when I do, they're very comfy, and feel very firmly on my feet without being too tight.I love the nubbed soles, they are just textured enough to give your feet a gentle massage without being distracting or annoying.In use, they're incredibly light and comfortable. My preference is for shoes you can forget you're wearing, and these definitely fit that description to a tee. I usually walk round the house barefoot for preference, but these I will keep on and forget I'm wearing even in doors. At the same time, I can happily walk round in them for several hours without any bad results.I wasn't convinced how comfortable they'd be, since they're basically kind of plastic. I remember loathing jelly shoes and similar. However, the material has not got sweaty or unpleasant to wear even on the hottest days I've worn them, and they're so well ventilated that my feet feel fresh all the time. The light foam material is surprisingly soft and forgiving to touch, even though the shoe as a whole feels fairly sturdy. Granted, I've only had them a few months, but they don't feel like they're about to fall apart on me or anywhere close.Last but not least: the colour. I confess, I bought the candy pink purely because they were the cheapest option in my size. They looked inoffensive in the picture, and I'm partial to a bit of pink, so I figured they'd be OK. Actually, they're really pretty and feminine - I was impressed. The colour is a very delicate, pretty pink, and has a decidedly pearly look about it. Obviously these aren't smart, formal shoes, but for crocs they're surprisingly attractive. Instead of being relegated to home and garden, I've worn them out and about to people's houses and to the shops without feeling like I was being a total scruffbag!In short: I'm a convert. Clearly, with crocs, one needs to experiment to find the ones that suit, but once you do... These babies will be used till they fall apart!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 September 2013

Title: My favourite comfy shoe
Review: My crocs are so comfortable and help cushion metatarsalgia in one of my feet. I wear them for gardening and generally out and about and have several pairs in different colours.  They are a loose fitting sandal type shoe with a good range of sizes.  Hope they make them forever!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 October 2020

Title: Not happy.
Review: Had wrong size delivered. Not happy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 June 2017

Title: A point to remember...
Review: I bought my Crocs years ago - when they were made in Italy.Nowadays, they all seem to be made in - yes you've guessed it - China.It's not an improvement in my opinion, as the rubber seems less flexible and the sizing is definitely iffy.I got my last pair - Crocs Relief, made in China ! - through Crocs and despite some reviews saying they came up " larger than size ", I chose a half size larger than usual and they were still a snug fit.THIS pair fits me perfectly, BUT I bought ONE WHOLE SIZE LARGER than my usual size 5, and when compared to my " old " Italian made, size 5s - they are SMALLER THAN THEM !!!So buyers,be aware of the sizing element.This pair was well priced though, and I DO recommend Crocs - they are really not that nice looking, but if you have foot problems ( I have Plantar Fasciitis ) or just wide feet, they are great !.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 August 2013

Title: Amazing stuff!
Review: I nearly purchased some Cocs about five years a go, but ultimately chose not to because I thought they looked ridiculous, regardless of how comfortable they supposedly were!I have finally given in and bought a pair, perhaps it's the fact I'm five years older and nearing forty?!I have to say they are amazing; they are so comfortable and a joy to wear. They feel great on the sole of your foot, and the level of comfort and support when walking is first class.Yes they do look a little silly perhaps, and I have promised my fiancee I won't be wearing them out of the house, they have been specifically purchased for use in the back garden; but then again promises are there to be broken!I'm very happy with this purchase, and yes, I'm a Croc convert!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 July 2012

Title: Too small, despite ordering the correct UK size
Review: Too small, despite ordering the correct UK size.  I always fit into UK size ten and half or size 11 shoes.Despite the fact that Amazon converts Crocs's american sizes to UK sizes in the ordering page, these crocs shoes were still too small.  When wearing them without the strap at the back lowered, they were OK.  But when wearing them with the strap lowered my toes nails scraped the the end of the shoe and it made the fit uncomfortable.I recommend you use Amazon's excellent "wardrobe" service where you can order many items of clothing in different sizes and then return the unwanted items without paying for them. The return process is easy, just rebag the items in the resealable bag , stick the return label on it and take it to a Royal Mail location.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 May 2019

Title: Made in Italy
Review: Looking at other reviews, I was a little concerned that I might get Crocs made in China. However, I can confirm that the navy Crocs I bought direcly from Amazon UK in August 2013 were made in Italy, both sizes 4 and 5. I first bought UK size 4, as this is my normal size, but they were small in length. I exchanged them to UK size 5, which are better in length. They are very wide, though; but this is the nature of Crocs, I suppose. I am happy with them as I wear them only by the pool or beach and not in the street.Buying shoes online and getting the sizing right is quite tricky. If it helps anyone, after some years of experience, I now decided that for women's UK size 4, I should sometimes be ready to get size 3 if the shoes are from Europe (e.g. Fly London) or size 5 if the shoes are from North America (e.g. Crocs; they are originally from Canada even if made in other countries these days). But I would always try size 4 first, naturally.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 September 2013

Title: True size and comfortable
Review: Having ordered directly from Crocs a Mens size 9 (M10 W12, made in China on the sole) , the shoes were a actually too large and had sharp spikes in the footbed , they were returned. Although these say the same size the sole (made in Bosnia), they are a true size 9 and the footbed is comfortable . Very pleased.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 July 2020

Title: love 'em
Review: Love these.. comfortable and convenient. Stick a pair by the back door to stop your kids running round the garden in their socks. Impress your partner with your new found sense of style. Ok maybe not the last bit. Kind of sorry I didn't go for Tangerine tho or a glow in the dark pair...!?
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 March 2019

Title: Love them
Review: I needed to replace my fake crocs from last summer but the cheap ones this summer didn't seem to fit properly.  I wear them all the time. They have gradually replaced my slippers during the day - great when you realise you have popped outside to put the washing out and it was wet and muddy - you just pop them under the tap - not so easy with fluffy slippers!  So when I found these at sale price I was over-the-moon.  I am a 6.5 and I bought size 7. They are comfy and versatile and they were also the only shoes I could squeeze on with swollen ankles for the last three weeks of my pregnancy. They are easy to put on when you just need to pop out to the car etc.  How did I ever manage without a pair.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 October 2009

Title: Crocs adult classic sandals
Review: Usually I take size 5.5 shoe but the size 5 sandal fits well (as long as toenails clipped!). The width is very good - space to spread your toes. I walk for miles in the countryside wearing these sandals (they have begun to squeak in protest when walking on pavements).  They keep your feet cool even on the hottest English summer days.  Added bonus is that I can join my dog in the river for a paddle.  They are very easy to clean.  Now I want to purchase a variety of colours:-)
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Chocolate
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 July 2014

Title: The shoes are fine but everytime I order a pair for one of ...

Title: Crocs !
Review: Bought these size fives for my wife, who kept 'borrowing' my size eights, and she is absolutely delighted with them. Well made, hard wearing, very comfortable to wear for even prolonged periods with or without the strap. Soles give good grip too.They are quite generous in size, and rather than 'go up' half a size from our normal fittings (5.5 and 8.5/9), we 'went down' half a size and they fit perfectly.Couldn't recommend them more !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 June 2012

Title: Confusing sizing
Review: Having read all the other reviews about being careful when choosing the right size, I made sure to really note the size and gender when selecting a suitable pair of CROCS......BUT if it is unisex, as this is, then there is no option of male or female and by selecting 8 it means men's 8, and women's 10.  Why can't this be made clearer?  I will have to exchange them now.  What a shame.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 July 2014

Title: Pop on, pop off !
Review: Great shoe, Ideal for back door garden duties.If dirty just wash in the shower or under the tap ! Job done...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 October 2019

Title: Excellent outdoor shoes
Review: Wanted some lightweight shoes for the garden, and do not like wearing opened toed sandals as I always catch my toes on something! These are excellent as cover the toes but are very light and comfy, as well as being totally waterproofHaving the strap that can be used round the heel is great if you need to keep them on and not slip offWill be buying another pair so can keep a pair at boh the front and back door.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 June 2012

Title: Great crocs
Review: I absolutely love these crocs especially in the bright colours. They're like walking around in the most comfortable of slippers and very durable. I bought two pair a couple of years ago and wore nothing else - even at work in the winter I would change into them and wear them around the office. I was really upset because they've now worn through under the toes so was really pleased to find them here.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 June 2013

Title: Crocs
Review: They saved our holiday , as my other half broke her foot before we went on our holiday and there was a time when I thought it was over but friends at work recomended these shoes to me so I got her a pair and you know something, holiday aside it has been 2 weeks since we came back and she is still wearing them. Will recommend them to every one. 5 star.  Gents think about it ,,,,, how much you can save.  Holiday to turkey Â£1000. Kebabs Â£5. Smile on her face walking painlessly with thoes Crocs shoes , priceless.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 November 2011

Title: Cross rule!!!
Review: The navy blue crocs  that I purchased recently are of the same brilliant standard as always. My family have been croc  wearer for the last 5 to 6 years and have not found a more comfier alternative. I have all styles and they are all equally comfy. They also last very well and i can get at least a years wear out of them before they start to look scruffy . Long live crocs , they rock. xxx
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 June 2013

Title: Perfect Crocs
Review: I ordered these Crocs for my husband, who had worn his last identical pair into the ground after 4 years of regular use. He is a size 9, but has very wide feet, so I ordered size 10/11. They fit perfectly. Although I ordered the same colour, this pair of Crocs seems to have a nicer finish than his last pair. Very pleased with this purchase.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 August 2014

Title: crocs are a saviour for ankle replacement
Review: My husband had an ankle replacement which was very successful but shoes became a major problem due to the enlarged joint and swelling when wearing normal shoes.  We bought some Crocs 3 years ago recommended by a friend to use on the beaches in Malta to prevent being stung by jelly fish.  We didn't see any jelly fish but he never looked back after that.  The Crocs have been in continuous use ever since, both with casual and smart gear and he is now on his 3rd pair.  The ankle doesn't swell even after a whole day's wear and he's prepared to put up with the jokes when he forgets to change shoes for special occasions.  We struggled to find any in the local shops this summer and are thankful for Amazon to keep up the stock.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 November 2009

Title: Soooo Comfortable
Review: Crocs are feet savers!  They may not look the prettiest - but once you have worn a pair of Crocs you will never regret your purchase!  These were a really good buy.  I have found that Crocs can vary in size depending on where they are manufactured.  However, being a shoe size 6 - I ordered in Crocs sizes M 6 / W 8 and they fitted perfectly! I would recommend Crocs as the most comfortable shoe in the world!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 May 2010

Title: personal
Review: Husband was so delighted to have a pair of Crocs and they fitted perfect
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 July 2019

Title: CROCS Cayman ... everything they promise to be
Review: Having seen the hype about these rather ugly, clown-like shoes, I thought them sufficiently raved-about to try a pair.  Now the owner of four pairs, I convinced my other half to buy a pair for 'round the house'.  This recent purchase is his second pair - we are both thoroughly 'won over'.  Light, comfortable, colourful, fun and affordable.  Advice on fitting would be definitely try them on first, as the sizes do differ.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 November 2009

Title: Good product
Review: Reliable product, fits as expected. Thanks to the quality of the plastic material it is very easy to clean them every so often.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 July 2018

Title: finally replaced the old ones
Review: these were for my partner and he was holding on to his 10 year old pair as crocs seemed to have stopeed this design and the others he tried were not good on his feet. perfect size as others seem to come up smaller and were made of different plastics which were causing a problem. A*
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 July 2014

Title: classic crocs
Review: These crocs arrived in good time. They are quite large but not overly (when they arrived it did say that they were the wide size. It didn't say that in the advert). Very comfortable to wear, can be worn with thick socks for out in the garden. So a good buy for for me.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2014

Title: Happy Feet
Review: My sister has raved about Crocs for years, so when I needed some casual summer shoes that would look OK with jeans or a denim skirt, I decided to give them a try. I'm so glad I did!  When I put them on for the first time, the soles of my feet did feel a little strange for around ten minutes or so when I was walking.  Once I was used to them, my feet were the most comfortable they had been in years.  I now wear them at every opportunity - this summer, I've had lots of practice at checking out how quickly they dry out after being caught in the rain, too!  I can wear them all day and almost forget I have shoes on at all.  This certainly won't be my last pair.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 August 2012

Title: Love 'em
Review: You either love Croc's or you loathe them. I love them and live in them all summer long and wear them indoors all year round. So light and airy to wear plus dead comfy. They're a godsend in a camper van and almost universally worn on campsites for good reason.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 August 2014

Title: Not the best looking but certainly the best comfort
Review: As I love spending time in my garden weather permitting I thought these CROCS shoes would be a great alternative to my wellies,I have them by my back door to slip on whenever I need to pop outside they are as comfy as slippers, so comfy I even walk my dog to the local field and it does'nt matter if the grass is wet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2009

Title: great product but sizing always a problem
Review: cheaper than anywhere else and arrived very speedily so was very pleased, but ordered a size bigger than I wanted...we already have crocs around so to have been able to see the numbers on the bottom of the shoe that I would end up with, rather than trying to approximate to a UK size, would have been helpful.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 August 2014

Title: Crocs
Review: These are a delight to wear. I actually bought these for slipping on and off when I went into the garden but after trying them out I would like to wear them ALL the time as they are so so comfy.  They are not elegant but if you suffer from painful feet I'm sure you would like them.
Size: Size: 5 UK Men/ 6 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 November 2011

Title: Genuine item
Review: You get what you pay for
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 July 2019

Title: Great all round casual shoes.
Review: Great all round casual shoe. It took a while to get my hubby to appreciate the plus points to Crocs - myself and the kids have been wearing them for ages.  Now he has, he wears them for gardening, washing the car, driving - you name it!  I dont think any of my family would be without them now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2010

Title: Excellent quality and fit
Review: I was wary about both fit and quality after reading the reviews, but pleased by both. Excellent value and as comfortable for my feet as my old ones bought years ago. For the record, my crocs were made in Italy rather than China.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2014

Title: Crocs
Review: Have had the Crocs for 5 days, still smiling when I put them on, the most comfortable footwear I've ever owned. I would wear them in the office, but not allowed as its against the dress code. Great to wear as the holes allow a breeze (what a lovely feeling!), brilliant to wear whilst driving. The ridges on the soles massage my feet, heaven.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 May 2013

Title: Crocs Cayman
Review: The most comfortable footwear I have used!My wife and I (these were for her) have been using Crocs for quite some time now. Since seeing a friend wearing them, and hearing him enthusing about them, we have had quite a few pairs.They are great on holiday as you can walk on the beach and in the sea, and they don't seem to come to any harm.If they get dirty they can be soaked or even washed in the washing machine.They are not much use for running or dancing, as you wear them loose, but then they don't claim to be universal.A great purchase.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 October 2009

Title: Crocs - why not!
Review: Love these things!  Great, lightweight, handy to keep in a camp bag for mooching about the site instead of pulling on boots in middle of the night.  Also wearable all day with comfort.  These stay on in a way that flip-flops or open backed clogs don't, so great for driving and "energetic" walking.  Also good for pool/sea side as they don't mind getting wet and they dry really quickly.  Like lightweight multi-purpose "Nature-treks" (just gave my age away there!).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 July 2010

Title: Very comfortable
Review: Ive only tried these on, not really walked out with them but the product despcription about their comfort is TRUE. This colour cotton candy is just lovely as its not a bright colour but still a nice colour so looks very nice its pearly.  I can feel these are going to be very comfortable for all day wear!  ID recommend these to everyone.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 October 2011

Title: Great shoes - very comfortable - wide fit
Review: I recently had a problem with one of my feet and had trouble walking. I found that Crocs were the only comfortable shoes I could wear, and have been using them exclusively for months on end. This is a third pair, although the others are still in good condition.Recommended for comfort for just about everything.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 September 2010

Title: Just does the job perfectly!
Review: These crocs cayman are so comfortable and a must for summer hols. I bought mine for a recent beach holiday and they are terrific on sand... especially when it gets too hot to walk on in bare feet. I wore them throughout the holiday and I'm so glad I bought them. I would say stick to ordering your usual size coz they are roomy. Happy ordering and holidays!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 April 2010

Title: Crocs rule
Review: I bought theses on a recommendation from a friend. I thought they were probably the ugliest shoes I'd ever set my eyes on. Put that to one side because they are the best footwear I've ever bought. They are light and comfortable beyond belief. The strange rubber like material keeps the feet cool and the textured insole keeps the feet alive. I took them on holiday to Cornwall and ended up wearing no other shoes for the entire holiday. They even coped with a long and difficult costal path walk. Cant sing their praises high enough. Need to order another pair because I'm going to wear these out the rate I'm going.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 September 2009

Title: Excellent
Review: I brought these for a present for my father in law and he hasnt had them off his feet (good job they're washable!).I have a pair myself and they are so comfy and don't make your feet sweaty.I would definately recommend these to anyone: they are a revolution!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 April 2009

Title: Super great footwear!!
Review: These are fantastic shoes for anyone, very comfortable to wear with socks or without. Ideal for summer months keep are kept cool. Soft material means they do not rub feet. Easy to clean and dry quickly. Come in a range of colours so can co-ordinate with outfits. Very reasonable if they are on offer as they last a long time.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 June 2010

Title: Huge
Review: These crocs are much too wide for me- like boats and I also find them too long. I am always a size 7 but these are ridiculously large. It will depend on how much it will cost to return these as to whether I will send them back. If too expensive will give to a friend.
Size: Size: 6 UK Men/ 7 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2014

Title: Never be without a pair
Review: Lightweight, hard wearing, go anywhere shoe. My son lives in them and I sneek them in the washing machine when he isn't looking, they come out like new. Excellent - saved me a fortune and the bother of shoe shopping because he doesn't moan that everything doesn't fit.
Size: Size: 4 UK Men/ 5 UK WomenColour: Black
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2009

Title: Crocs - adult - slip-on shoes
Review: Very comfortable and light with nice wide fitting. Good for those (like me) with foot problem. I wear them around house instead of slippers. Light spongy material keeps warmth in. Wide fitting enables thick socks to be worn.Not sure how good they would be for use outside.
Size: Size: 9 UK Men/ 10 UK WomenColour: Navy
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 February 2011

Title: Brilliant
Review: Never thought that you would get me walking around in these things. I've had to think again, bought one pair, took them on holiday and wore nothing else. These I just bought are a different colour, just to let people know I have more than one pair of shoes. They are the only shoes I will take on holiday. Go in one pair and pack the others. They are so light too. Just one thing, buy a size larger.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 March 2010

Title: So Comfortable
Review: After reading all the reviews I had to have some.They have hardly been of my feet since,you don't know that you have got them on.Easy to clean,just rinse under the tap.I am normally a size 8 but ordered a 7 and they are just right.A bit expensive but well worth it

Title: Crocs clog
Review: Delighted with these genuine crocs, so much better than the cheapies I bought at the seaside. So comfy I forget I have them on, I shall be coming back to buy some more in another colour. Such quick delivery too.If you are thinking about buying these just go for it, you will not be disappointed.

Title: execellent
Review: execellent

I initially began wearing crocs due to a painful heel and quickly felt the benefit.  I would recommend anyone with foot problems to seriously consider purchasing a pair...my painful feet are history; yours could be too!

Title: The Best summer Shoes!

Title: Be careful re sizing!
Review: This item was advertised as size 4 however on arrival they are labelled as 3/4 and so were just totally the wrong size, too small.It think it would have been helpful for a more accurate description and actual sizes to be available as I will not risk another order as the only option available it would seem is now a 5/6 which is likely to be too big so a lost sale.
Size: Size: 3 UK Men/ 4 UK WomenColour: Black

Title: Crocs
Review: Bought as a Christmas present so not actually worn yet, but same as previous pair, which I have been very happy with.  Colour seems a little darker than shown on picture, but doesn't matter. Very comfortable to wear, have worn other pair all year!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 December 2011

Title: Lovely crocs
Review: I live in my Crocs, so when my current pair gave up the ghost, I needed a new pair. These are great, but the sizing is very slightly small - they are a neat fit - so if you are between sizes, go for the larger size.

Title: Brilliant
Review: Exactly what I wanted at half the price to what I paid previously in the shops. Great fit, extremely comfortable and fantastic to wear out in the summer or indoors as slippers. Been back and bought a 2nd pair for my husband since.

Title: Very comfortable
Review: I have bought Crocs before and have always found them to be very comfortable. These are just as good. I live in Spain and find Crocs are one of the best things to wear, particularly at home in the summer, because they are lightweight and are washable. They might not be very elegant or glamorous but that isn't why I bought them.  For me, they are comfy and practical. Perfick!

Title: Crocs for Fractured Ankle
Review: The crocs were purchased for my wife who is recovering from a broken ankle. She finds then ideal and can now get out and about. They are very pracicable and also very presentable, She finds them comfortable and they are a great aid to her recovery.

Title: excellent service
Review: i bought these for 11 pounds , a bargain in the sale :)  they are true to size, comfy and a great colour , the delivery came within a couple of days, superb!

Title: Crocs for all year
Review: I love the genuine Crocs - nothing else is quite as good.  Wide enough for someone with wide feet, comfortable  and able to wear with or without socks.

Title: Good product but too small
Review: Might be worth noting that Crocs are manufactured in several countries.  They all look the same and are of similar quality but the 'moulds' used in each location can differ by anything up to a full shoe size so you can't always rely on them fitting even if you order identical sizes.  I didn't know about this until after I'd ordered them.  However returning these was very easy and I am waiting for a replacement pair - just a bit bigger!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 June 2014

Title: great crocs
Review: at first i was a bit worried about the sizing cos of other reviews but as im a size 7 i ordered a 7 and they fit perfect . will order again when i need another pair as they are so comfy

Title: Best Buy
Review: I purchased these Unisex Caymen Clog's for my husbandas being a diabetic he needs protection when on holidayto go in the sea and walk on the sand to protect from sharp objects.

Title: Perfect home for my feet

Title: so light and comfortable
Review:
Crocs Adult Cayman

i suffer with painful arthritic joints in my feet and found it difficult to find something comfortable and light to wear on my feet. then i discovered crocs-whatever did i do before ????? i now wear caymen crocs in the warmer weather and the mammouth crocs in the colder weather. i wouldnt be without them.

A great advantage with Crocs is the ability to wash the whole shoe e.g. a muddy forest walk or a sandy beach walk (though not in winter)and it only takes 5 minutes.There are a number of styles available all equally as comfortable, but some more stylish than others. I wouldn't be without them.

Title: Crocs

NO CRUTCHES, NO FULL LEG SPLINT!I can't wait to receive mine now :D100/10 would recommend. Wenn sie nach vorne geklappt ist, kann man einfacher reinschlÃ¼pfen und sie wie Badelatschen verwenden, wenn man mehr Halt braucht, kann man sie auch zurÃ¼ckklappen. Die Sohle ist ziemlich stabil, sodass man keine Angst haben muss, wenn man auf spitze Steine o.Ã¤. tritt. Da die Schuhe einfach nur aus Kunststoff bestehen, saugen sie kein Wasser auf und sind schnell wieder trocken.- Man kann die Crocs in Hostels mit teilweise etwas dreckigen Duschen wunderbar auch beim Duschen anziehen.- Die Schuhe sind sehr robust.
